name: ambassadoroamaru.co.nz
homepage_content: Oamaru Motel Accommodation - ASURE Ambassador Motor Lodge CHECK AVAILABILITY FIND THE BEST RATE WELCOME TO ASURE AMBASSADOR MOTOR LODGE Motel Accommodation in Oamaru Wiley welcomes you to ASURE Ambassador Motor Lodge situated at the north end of the Oamaru Central Business District. At our 11-unit motel we strive to offer the best in comfort and hospitality, offering home-baked muffins to all guests on arrival. As we have both travelled extensively we feel we have good insight to travellers' needs and are happy to assist with itineraries if required. Rooms Our room layouts comprise studio, 1 and 2-bedroom units, 6 with spa baths. All are ground-floor and smoke-free. Off-street-parking at your unit door. Studio Unit Studio Unit with Spa Bath Studio Access Unit 1 Bedroom Spa Unit Executive 1 Bedroom Unit 1 Bedroom Family Unit 2 Bedroom Family Unit #1 2 Bedroom Family Unit #2 Visiting Oamaru Oamaru is 116km from Dunedin, 283km from Christchurch and is known as the Gateway to the Waitaki and Southern Lakes District. Oamaru, described as 'New Zealand's best kept secret' is recognised as a destination town with the world-renowned Yellow and Blue Penguin Colonies. Stay with us, relax and take time to enjoy the many wonderful attractions the Waitaki Region has to offer. A two-minute drive takes you through the town centre to Victorian Oamaru with its beautiful white-stone architecture, the magnificent Opera House and the famous blue and yellow-eyed penguin colonies. Other attractions nearby are Whitestone Cheese, world-class Public Gardens, the Moeraki Boulders, the Fossil Trail and Steampunk Headquarters. View Rooms Our Airbnb Accommodation Welcome to White Oasis ‚Äì a cosy, stylish two-bedroom retreat just a 10-minute walk from supermarkets, shops, and caf√©s, yet tucked away in a peaceful setting where you can truly relax. Inside, unwind beneath rustic Australian ironbark beams in the living area, where a baby grand piano invites musical moments. Enjoy modern comforts, including a fully equipped kitchen with a Lavazza coffee machine and a 55" Panasonic smart TV ‚Äì all surrounded by the tranquillity of nature. A Bosch laundry makes longer stays easy, while Oamaru's Victorian charm and famous blue penguins await nearby. When the sun's out, fire up the BBQ and dine alfresco. Unlimited complimentary WiFi keeps you connected throughout your stay. Visit White Oasis 2018 RECOGNITION OF EXCELLENCE ASURE Ambassador Motor Lodge HotelsCombined 9.2 Rated by Guests ASURE_Ambassador_Motor_Lodge Call us on 0800 437 214 to book direct and save We are members of the ASURE Accommodation Group which consists of quality, independently owned and operated accommodation properties throughout New Zealand. Our ASURE loyalty programme: stay 10 nights at any three ASURE properties throughout New Zealand and receive a $100 credit off your 10th night. To see information on all our properties and for checking availability in any of these properties, click here. Your Deal Today

name: jetcharmbarbershop.co.nz
homepage_content: Jetcharm - Jetcharm Barbershop and Cafe Facebook Instagram 06 758 8840 32 Egmont St, CBD, New Plymouth Contact BOOK NOW 0 Items } Barbershop Hours Monday 9-5pm Tuesday/Wednesday/Friday 9-6pm Thursday 9-7:30pm Saturday 8-4pm Sun 10-3 } Cafe Hours Monday-Friday 7.30-4pm Saturday 8-4pm Sun closed ÓÄ≥ FREE SHIPPING for orders over $60 Jetcharm Merch Available Shipping NZ only BOOK NOW SERVICES cuts Our barbers are fully trained and passionate about their trade and at the cutting edge of men‚Äôs hair styling. If you are looking for that brand new hairstyle whether it be a high fade quiff haircut, messy undercut, modern slicked back pompadour with tapered fade, crew cut or textured top with zero fade sides, then come and see us. All cuts styled & finished off with the razor clean up & boxing out by the masters fades Our master barbers are all skilled in the art of the mean low fades, high fades, taper fades & zero fades beard trims Beards are the new six packs and its important to keep your beard under control, neat and straight. Styling your beard is as important as getting up each day and we are happy to help you choose the right style to suit your face. Whether its shaving or trimming with sharp precise lines near your cheek bones, keeping your beard short on the sides and fuller on the sides, we are here to discuss the right look for you, finally finishing off with our specialty beard oil we will have you sorted HOT TOWEL SHAVES There are a a lot of great things about our barbershop but one of the best parts of it is the traditional straight razor shave. Using the heat from the towels to soften up your beard & make the shave less irritating for the skin this classic ritual gets you the nicest closest comfortable shave and oh so stinking relaxing. The Hot Towel Shave was a lost art in Taranaki until we bought it back. Its an experience you must try at least once in your life if you call yourself a man. hot towel shaves There are a a lot of great things about our barbershop but one of the best parts of it is the traditional straight razor shave. Using the heat from the towels to soften up your beard & make the shave less irritating for the skin this classic ritual gets you the nicest closest comfortable shave and oh so stinking relaxing. The Hot Towel Shave was a lost art in Taranaki until we bought it back. Its an experience you must try at least once in your life if you call yourself a man. view about us View our merchandise ABOUT US Pure Excellence Our Barbershop is a Barbershop offering the Royal Treatment from the moment you walk through the door to your departure. We specialise in old-style techniques using modern tools ‚Äì from razor-fades, straight edge razor shaves, beard trims, patterns & braids/fades. Our barbers have a passion for male grooming and cutting edge trends. Our Barbershop is a great place to get a haircut, shop for the latest products or generally come and hang. Before, during or after your cut you can grab a coffee/healthy snack from our Barbershop Caf√©. We offer Wedding Packages (including breakfast/beers) so the boys can be pampered and look sharp for their special day. Our main focus is on tight fades inspired by the refined men‚Äôs styles of the 1920‚Äôs and 40‚Äôs however our barbers are capable of creating cuts from that edgy freestyle cut to that of the rockabilly style . Our shop pulses with warm energy and you‚Äôll always hear a chorus of people speaking to one another with furious excitement. We pride ourselves on being part of the local community; taking an active interest in what‚Äôs going on locally and engaging our social conscience. Whether it be a regular trim or a free style cut, click the book now button to book yourself in. We got you on this!!! OUR TEAM Barber Lachie Barber Lachie is our boy wonder and Barbershop Manager. Lachie completed his apprenticeship with us in December 2017. Lachie not only produces great work he is community minded and frequently giving his time for good causes such as gala days, school balls, surf life-saving events to name but a few. Lachie has won various national awards including the beard trim competition in the apprentice division of Barbercraft in 2017 & the Hair and Barber New Zealand People‚Äôs Choice and Classic Cut Awards in 2022. Facebook Twitter BARBER JOEY Barber Joey is originally from and trained in the Philippines Barber & comes to us with the sweetest likeable and eager to please personality. Joey has mastered the art of beard trimming, hot towel shaves, style cuts and patterns. Joey always goes the extra mile to ensure his clients are beaming with joy when they walk out the door. Facebook Twitter Barber Chris Barber Chris is a senior barber originally from the UK who joined us in February 2022. Chris is a friendly confident chap with a likeable personality and a flair for barbering. Chris will give you a charming experience that will have you wanting to come back for more. One of Chris‚Äô best attributes is his concern for and desire to help people less privileged than himself be it by helping to feed the homeless or bringing about community awareness to social issues via his weekly Radio Show on Tuesday mornings (9-10am) with the Most FM. Can‚Äôt leave off the fact that Chris is absolutely brilliant in dealing with toddlers and youth haircuts. Facebook Twitter Barber Toby Barber Toby commenced his apprenticeship with us February 2022. Toby has a passion for barbering and is always looking for the next best thing in barbering. Don‚Äôt mistake Toby‚Äôs quietness for lack of interests as Toby is a very deep thinker and knowledgeable on lots of things including local music. In his spare time you will find Toby either practicing for or playing gigs in his band ‚ÄúGreenbathing‚Äù. Facebook Twitter Barber Jordan Barber Jordan is originally from Whangarei & comes to us as a senior barber having been cutting for over 6 years. Jordan is passionate about his craft, loves a challenge & will without a doubt exceed your expectations everytime. Jordan is a family man who dotes on his 3 beautiful children. Jordan has the gift of the gab, flair, diligence and a willingness to please which is sure to impress you. Facebook Twitter Barber George Barber George & Louis are identical twins and both starting working for Jetcharm in 2018 as young Francis Douglas school boys sweeping floors. George & Louis have both been trained in the skills of barbering by Lachie and our other senior barbers over the last few years and now bring their huge personalities along with their honed barbering to skills to Jetcharm in the uni holidays where they are currently studying business/commerce. George is an absolute delight to have in the shop with his easy going entrepreneurial nature and willingness to please Facebook Twitter Barber Louis Barber Louis & George are identical twins and both starting working for Jetcharm in 2018 as young Francis Douglas school boys sweeping floors. Louis & George have both been trained in the skills of barbering by Lachie and our other senior barbers over the last few years and now bring their huge personalities along with their honed barbering to skills to Jetcharm in the uni holidays where they are currently studying business/commerce. Louis has the biggest smile & heart and will make sure you receive nothing but the Royal Treatment at Jetcharm. Facebook Twitter view about us View our merchandise Healthy Smoothie Bowls Healthy smoothie bowls topped with homemade granola and fresh fruit/ Protein shakes/smoothie drinks V/GF Available Our Barbershop Download our own free ‚ÄòJetcharm Barbers‚Äô App so you can join the walk-in queue from anywhere or make an advance future booking. Weddings Exclusive use of our barbershop for your special day ‚Äì packages available with or without breakfast/beers. Wedding photographers welcome. Loyalty Coffee ‚Äì pay upfront for 10 coffees & receive 11th coffee free. Barber Services ‚Äì pay for 10 services & receive 11th service free CONTACT ÓÄù 32 Egmont St New Plymouth v Phone: 06 758 8840 essay writing ÓÄê jetcharm2@hotmail.co.nz Name Phone Number Email Address Message Submit Think Jetcharm for your Special Day find out more Copyright ¬© ‚Äì Jetcharm Barber Shop & Gentleman‚Äôs Quarters All Rights Reserved

homepage_content: Kebabs on Queen | Best kebabs in Auckland | 12 Remuera Road, Newmarket, Auckland 1050, New Zealand top of page Kebabs on Queen ‚Äì The Way You Like It! Delicious, authentic flavors crafted with secret family recipes. VIEW MENU BOOK CARAVAN Your Favorites, Always Fresh and Customizable Discover the Flavors You Love From our iconic kebab wraps to indulgent sides and desserts, every dish is made to order with fresh, natural ingredients. Explore our menu and create your perfect meal. VIEW MENU Bring the Flavor to Your Event Bring the authentic flavours of Kebabs on Queen to your event. From weddings to corporate gatherings, our fully-equipped Turkish kitchen on wheels delivers freshly made, customisable dishes your guests will love. Ready to make your event unforgettable? LEARN MORE Every Day Is a Good Day to Enjoy a Kebab! The Journey Behind the Flavor From a small family dream to a New Zealand icon, Kebabs on Queen has been crafting authentic flavors and unforgettable memories for over 25 years. Explore our story of passion, tradition, and community. OUR JOURNEY FOLLOW US @kebabsonqueen #YummyEats REVIEWS Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5 ‚ÄúMesmerising food, looked very clean and tidy kitchen. The inside of the shop is amazing. The meat on chips sent my soul to heaven, the lamb was so good I‚Äôm craving more already. Service was amazing, everything about it was amazing. This food changed my life. Dietary restrictions: They catered to all dietary needs, such as gluten free, vegan, vegetarian etc Kid-friendliness: Very good atmoaphere‚Äù Sora Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5 ‚ÄúLove this location have watched people day and day out disrespecting the workers here, it‚Äôs a kids meal. The amount of temper tantrums I‚Äôve watched, every time the staff have handled it beautifully, food is incredible service is incredible. The customers are the problem. LOVE THE STAFF AT KEBABS ON QUEEN‚Äù Grace Marshall Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 4/5 ‚ÄúFreshest ingredients in town...great value for money...and what a turnover!!! The food is made fresh when ordered. Lovely variety of menu items - both veg and non-veg (menu uploaded) An extremely clean and hygenic place. We received our order pretty quickly and the portions were generous. The chef Shyam is extremely professional and extended warm hospitality. The only downside is that the shop itself is located at a crossing, and is smallish, so anythn more than 2-3 mid-sized groups would be a tad much. The good thing is that the wraps are perfect for take-out. Overall - definitely recommend.‚Äù Vinita Sean Rodrigues arrow icon bottom of page

name: wellingtoncityheritage.org.nz
homepage_content: Huddart Parker Building - Wellington Heritage - Absolutely Positively Wellington City Council Me Heke Ki Poneke Search 2 - 6 Jervois Quay (1 Post Office Square), Wellington, Wellington ‚ù∞ ‚ù± Image: WCC - Charles Collins, 2015 Cityview GIS 2012 Post Office Square. Image: WCC Archives ref 00138_0_08668 Map Constructed 1924 - 1925 Heritage Area Post Office Square Architect(s) Crichton, McKay & Haughton Builder(s) Mitchell and King The building is a very bold and competent example of Chicago-style architecture and was designed by Crighton, McKay and Haughton a prominent and longstanding Wellington architectural practice. The building is situated on a prominent corner site at a corner of Post Office Square and Jervois Quay and has a strong street presence particularly when view from the north. The building is part of a group of significant heritage buildings that form the Post Office Square Heritage Area, and of a group of heritage buildings that owed their existence to the nearby wharf trade. The building retains the name of Huddart Parker, a large trans-Tasman shipping company and is historically significant for being the last of the shipping industry buildings still standing alongside the waterfront. Downloadable(s) Download this content as PDF close History Huddart Parker was a Melbourne based shipping company which ran services between Australia and New Zealand. They had offices on Post Office Square, in Queen‚Äôs Chambers (so named for its proximity to Queens Wharf) from 1893. Prior to this the site was occupied by the Pier Hotel, built on land reclaimed by the Provincial Government between 1857 and 1863. Queen‚Äôs Chambers were damaged by fire in 1923 the building was later demolished (‚Äúwrecked to ground level‚Äù), along with T. & W. Young‚Äôs warehouse next door in Jervois Quay and, in their place, a new building was constructed for Huddart Parker in 1924. It was designed by Crichton, McKay and Haughton and built by Mitchell and King and opened in February 1925. Huddart Parker became one of the key players in the trans-Tasman shipping trade, a major rival of the Union Steam Ship Company of New Zealand. Huddart, Parker & Co. Ltd was founded in 1876 in Geelong by James Huddart, T.J. Parker, John Traill, and Captain T. Webb. James Huddart‚Äôs uncle, Captain Peter Huddart made his fortune as a coal merchant for use in the Victorian goldfields in the 1850s and T.J. Parker had been a merchant, shipping agent and (later) ships owner in Geelong from circa 1853. The company was successful and by 1882 had established a service between Melbourne and Sydney and by 1886 ran another between Melbourne and Adelaide. In the 1890s the shipping company covered the principal ports in New South Wales, Victoria, South Australia, Western Australia and Tasmania, with a route to New Zealand established in 1893. Wellington was selected as the location for a New Zealand Headquarters, and the company operated from No.3 Queen‚Äôs Chambers. The company ran the steam ship Tasmania on a route from Auckland to Napier, Wellington, Lyttleton and Sydney every three weeks from December 1893, and other routes followed thereafter. Huddart Parker also operated the Australia, New Zealand and Canada mail route for many years from 1893, and it seems likely that the New Zealand to Australia shipping route was established so as to secure government subsidies for the Canada mail run. One of their ships, the Wanganella, was involved in one of most protracted and famous ship groundings in the history of the port of Wellington, after it ran on to Barrett‚Äôs Reef on 19 January 1947. The Wanganella had earlier been requisitioned as an Australian Hospital Ship and served in the Middle East, New Guinea, Solomon Islands, Borneo and the South Pacific and it was ironic that she ran into Barrett‚Äôs Reef on her maiden voyage after the war. The stranded boat became a major local attraction until, three weeks later, completely stripped of its cargo and fuel, it was finally hauled off the rocks. The company‚Äôs repair and salvage costs were substantial. Huddart Parker Ltd was taken over by Bitumen and Oil Refineries of Australia Limited in 1961, but though the company no longer exists the Huddart Parker building still bears its name. The building was substantially refurbished between 1987 and 1990. Until the 2000s it was well known as the headquarters of the New Zealand Rugby Football Union. The (1963) combined clock and temperature display on top of the building was also once a familiar inner-city landmark. The display was said to be the first ‚Äúweather forecast in lights‚Äù for New Zealand and was operated from the meteorological office. The display used a pattern of 1.5m high lights to create the words ‚Äúfine‚Äù, ‚Äúcloudy‚Äù, ‚Äúrain‚Äù, ‚Äúchange‚Äù or ‚Äúgale‚Äù and the latter was chosen in ‚Äúrecognition of Wellington‚Äôs peculiar needs.‚Äù The display, which was designed to be read from the Wellington Railway Station, also showed the time in hours, minutes and seconds. It was noted that although Auckland had a sign that displayed the time, Christchurch one that displayed the weather forecast and Dunedin one that displayed the temperature and the time, Wellington‚Äôs was the only one that was linked to an official source such as the Met Office. The weather forecast in lights was reminiscent of an earlier Provincial Observatory and adjacent Time Ball. The Time Ball was used to recalibrate ship‚Äôs chronometers which in turn were used during journeys to establish longitude, an essential requirement for navigation. The Provincial Observatory was established in 1863 and used to take astronomical, meteorological and climatological readings. Both the Customhouse and Provincial Observatory were located at Queen‚Äôs Wharf, very close to the future site of the Huddart Parker Building. The Huddart Parker building is now owned by the Fruitgrower‚Äôs Charitable Trust who plan to refurbish and strengthen the building with a proposed completion date of 2013. Modifications close 1857 - 1863 Reclamation c.1865 Pier Hotel constructed c.1888 Queen‚Äôs Chambers constructed 1889 Pier Hotel moved to the corner of Customhouse Quay and Grey Street 1893 Huddart Parker occupied offices in Queen‚Äôs Chambers 1925 Huddart Parker Building opened 1941 Fruit-grower‚Äôs Charitable Trust moved into the building 1961 Huddart Parker Ltd sold to Bitumen and Oil Refineries of Australia Limited 1963 - 1964 Weather-clock constructed on the roof (C15146) 2005 Fruitgrower‚Äôs Charitable Trust accumulated 100% of ownership of the building. 2012 Fruitgrower‚Äôs Charitable Trust accumulated 100% of ownership of the building. Occupation History close Not assessed close Architectural Information Building Classification(s) close Not assessed Architecture close The Huddart Parker building is a good example of what has become known as the Chicago style. The design follows Louis Sullivan‚Äôs dictum that a building should have a base, trunk and be properly capped. The two-storey base, comprising the ground and first floors, is quite traditional in design. Heavily rusticated, it has a balustraded hood over the main entrance, a plain entablature, and small balconies supported by consoles at second-floor level in the centre and at both ends of the building. A plain cornice separates this base from the four-storey shaft above. The shaft is more transitional in appearance. Plain and unadorned, with a regular hierarchy of single, paired or triple windows, the shaft exploits the new steel-frame technology that allowed a greater ratio of window to wall area. A horizontal emphasis is present on the facade, balancing the vertical, and giving a sense of proportion and harmony to the building. A pronounced cornice divides the shaft from the building‚Äôs seventh-floor ‚Äúcrown‚Äù. This crown is capped by a dentilled cornice and a shallow stepped parapet. Balconies repeat the design and placement of those on the third floor. The building is sparely ornamented, with most of its feature deriving from the composition of the key architectural elements ‚Äì the rusticated base, strong pattern of windows and the small balconies and prominent cornice lines. This gives the building an elegant formal quality. The most important fa√ßade is that to Grey Street which contains the main entrance to the building. The central three bays of the fa√ßade are brought forward of the two corner bays and the entrance is given additional prominence with an overhanging balcony at the second floor level. The exterior of the building remains largely unaltered. Materials close Reinforced concrete piles, structural frame, piers, columns, beams, floor and roof slabs. Timber ceiling joists with fibrous plaster ceilings The original drawings are faint, but the external walls appear to be constructed in reinforced concrete, and the floors to the WCs directly behind the main stair appear to be constructed with timber joists & flooring. Internal walls ‚Äì reinforced concrete walls to stair, elevator, WCs and strong-rooms. Coke filled ‚Äúpatent coke breeze blocks‚Äù for all other partitions Entrance vestibule ‚Äì marble cladding Setting close Post Office Square heritage area is a significant and popular urban open space of over 100 years standing surrounded by a group of important former harbour board and commercial buildings. The area is named for the former General Post Office (GPO), which occupied the site of the present-day Hotel Intercontinental and IBM Tower on Customhouse Quay from 1863 to 1974. The heritage area is not really a square in the conventional sense but it is an open, definable space at the confluence of a number of important streets, and is closely related to the establishment and use of the waterfront by the former Wellington Harbour Board (WHB). In particular, the square was, and is, the key point of access to Queens Wharf, Wellington‚Äôs most historically important wharf. The square was created partly by 19th century additions to the original 1857-63 reclamation which gave room to construct buildings on the eastern side of the square and accommodate traffic and even, for a period, a railway. A statue of Queen Victoria was placed there in 1906 (and later removed in 1911), while the island was formed in 1912 to accommodate the tram shelter that later became Clarrie Gibbons. The island has grown considerably in extent since then. With a couple of notable exceptions, the square has undergone only incremental change since the early 20th century and, as a result, it has maintained its basic configuration and essential characteristics. It is, despite the presence of modern buildings on the edges, still recognisably the same place it was 100 years ago. Post Office Square is a place of high heritage value and importance to Wellington and contains a number of significant heritage buildings. It is a place very familiar to many Wellingtonians and is passed daily by thousands of people, in cars or on foot. The Post Office Square heritage area is principally an open space defined by a number of significant heritage buildings. The area includes all the buildings bounding the square ‚Äì on Grey Street and Customhouse and Jervois Quays, as well as Sheds 11 and 13 to the immediate north and the nearby Wharf Offices and Bond Store buildings. The boundary follows the property lines of the key buildings surrounding the square and extends across Jervois Quay to pick up the four former WHB buildings. With one exception, all the buildings within the area boundary contribute to the formation and qualities of the square. Wharf Offices (Shed 7 / Wharf Office Apartments, 1896) Head Office and Bond Store (Museum of Wellington - City and Sea, 1891-92) Shed 11 (1904-05) Shed 13 (1904-05) Clarrie Gibbons Store (and traffic island, 1912) Huddart Parker Building, 2-6 Jervois Quay (1924) Tower Building, 50 ‚Äì 64 Customhouse Quay (1936) Intercontinental Hotel, 2 Grey Street (1988) Todd Corporation Building, 95 Customhouse Quay, (1987) Chapman Tripp Building, 1-13 Grey Street (1976) With the exception of the latter two, these are all buildings of high heritage significance. There are a number of other features within the square and on its margins that can be considered part of the heritage area, many of which contribute to its values, including the Queens Wharf gates (1899), a heritage telephone box (c.1938) and a heritage postal box (dating from between 1879 and 1910). close Cultural Value The building is a very bold and competent example of Chicago-style architecture and was designed by Crighton, McKay and Haughton a prominent and longstanding Wellington architectural practice. The building is situated on a prominent corner site at a corner of Post Office Square and Jervois Quay and has a strong street presence particularly when view from the north. The building is part of a group of significant heritage buildings that form the Post Office Square Heritage Area, and of a group of heritage buildings that owed their existence to the nearby wharf trade. The building retains the name of Huddart Parker, a large trans-Tasman shipping company and is historically significant for being the last of the shipping industry buildings still standing alongside the waterfront. Aesthetic Value close Architectural Does the item have architectural or artistic value for characteristics that may include its design, style, era, form, scale, materials, colour, texture, patina of age, quality of space, craftsmanship, smells, and sounds? The building is a very bold and competent example of Chicago-style architecture. Group Is the item part of a group of buildings, structures, or sites that taken together have coherence because of their age, history, style, scale, materials, or use? The building is part of a group of significant heritage buildings that form the Post Office Square Heritage Area. Townscape Does the item have townscape value for the part it plays in defining a space or street; providing visual interest; its role as a landmark; or the contribution it makes to the character and sense of place of Wellington? The building is situated on a prominent corner site at a corner of Post Office Square and Jervois Quay and has a strong street presence particularly when viewed from the north. Its rooftop has long been occupied by signage, historically by an illuminated clock and weather forecast, presently by an advertisement for a local radio station and a temperature display. This signage takes advantage of the prominence of the building, particularly for passing traffic along the key transport route of Customhouse and Jervois Quays. Historic Value close Association Is the item associated with an important person, group, or organisation? The building retains the name of Huddart Parker, a large trans-Tasman shipping company and is historically significant for being the last of the shipping industry buildings still standing alongside the waterfront. The building was designed by Crighton, McKay and Haughton, a prominent and longstanding Wellington architectural practice. Association Is the item associated with an important historic event, theme, pattern, phase, or activity? The building is associated with the nineteenth and twentieth century shipping industry. Scientific Value close Archaeological Does the item have archaeological value for its ability to provide scientific information about past human activity? Central City NZAA R27/270 Social Value close Identity Sense Of Place Continuity Is the item a focus of community, regional, or national identity? Does the item contribute to sense of place or continuity? The building fa√ßade has remained (relatively) unaltered for over 80 years and makes a strong positive contribution to the sense of place and continuity of the BNZ /Head Office Heritage Area. Sentiment Connection Is the item a focus of community sentiment and connection? The building once held community sentiment and connection for the temperature display and clock that was a prominent feature on the roof. This has somewhat diminished since the removal of the display. Level of Cultural Heritage Significance close Authentic Does the item have authenticity or integrity because it retains significant fabric from the time of its construction or from later periods when important additions or modifications were carried out? The building exterior has had few intrusive modern alterations and additions and retains much of the authentic building fabric. Local / Regional / National / International Importance close Not assessed close Site Detail District Plan Number 17/ 155 Legal Description LOT 11 DP 11204 on CT WN33D/660. homepage_content: Andiamo 194 Jervois rd Monday - Tuesday, 4pm - late Wednesday - Sunday, 12pm - late Make a Booking Explore our menu Make a booking Discover what‚Äôs on Andiamo is nothing without Herne Bay We‚Äôre here because the neighbourhood made us who we are. Modern Italian with a wink of nostalgia, strong drinks poured slow, and long lunches that drift into dinner. Come for the comfort and good intentions, stay because plans always change. View Menu Bookings We take bookings online for groups of up to 8 guests. For groups larger than this, please email us directly. Our outdoor tables are very popular and available on a first-come, first served basis. We‚Äôre happy to note any seating preferences, though we can‚Äôt always guarantee specific tables. name: bayviewhotelnapier.co.nz
homepage_content: Bay View Hotel in Napier, New Zealand - Official Site Welcome to Bay View Hotel & Holiday Park, Napier Book Now A short 8km drive north from the center of Napier is the village of Bay View. At the heart of this community is the Bay View Hotel. Whether a local or a visitor to the area, you are assured of a warm, friendly welcome and you will enjoy great food, a bistro menu operates Tuesday - Sunday. We also offer a range of cafe food including scones, savoury and sweet options and are the last cafe north leaving Napier. Locally owned and operated, this 50-year-old hotel offers ample parking, comfortable indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the peace and quiet of the surrounding countryside. The hotel's main bar has a pool table, juke box and two TVs, great for watching two things at once! The friendly staff can usually be persuaded to change channels... unless of course the All Blacks are playing. There is a gaming room, bottle store and the large lounge is available for private functions. The Hotel has a Cafe which is open Tuesday-Sunday boasting delicious cafe food, coffee and a full bistro menu which operates in the evening as well from 5pm. A perfect place to relax and enjoy a Kiwi experience. PIG ON A SPIT EVERY SUNDAY All roads lead to the Bay View Hotel for the famous Pig on a Spit. The jewel in the crown is the famous, not to be missed Pig on a Spit... Sunday evenings at 6pm. Bookings are essential. The Buffet style meal harks back to "Family Roast Sundays" and along with a selection of beer, wines and spirits, you are guaranteed a fulfilling dining experience, you will soon realise why this is a highlight of the Bay View Hotel's hospitality. Adults $32 per head - Senior Citizens $30 - Children: Under 12 $15 and Under 5 is free Liquor Centre Bottle Store open 7 days a week offering monthly specials and promotions see our Facebook page for more details Hotel Motel & Holiday Park Pig on a Spit

Our Mission: is to strive to provide the best possible guest experience. Videos Rooms Executive Studio Enjoy a spacious, non-smoking room for 2 guests with a plush king bed, free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Each room includes a modern ensuite (some with spa baths), a fully equipped kitchenette with complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, plus thoughtful extras like leather seating, workspace, and family amenities on request. Featuring a luxurious king bed plus a king single, free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Each room includes a modern ensuite (some with spa baths), a well-equipped kitchenette with complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, along with comfortable seating, workspace, and family-friendly amenities on request. Learn More Easy Accessible Studio Our easy access room for two guests is thoughtfully designed for comfort and convenience, featuring special bathroom fittings with a walk-in spacious shower, wide doorways, and accessible kitchenette facilities. Relax with a plush king bed, free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, along with comfortable seating, workspace, and practical amenities, ensure every guest enjoys a relaxing and hassle-free stay. Learn More One-Bedoom Apartment Enjoy the comfort of a spacious suite with a separate bedroom and lounge, perfect for added privacy and relaxation. A plush king bed along with a bathroom that features a spa bath with shower overhead, while the kitchenette offers bench-top cooking facilities alongside complimentary tea, coffee, and milk. Free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, reverse-cycle air conditioning, and thoughtful extras ensure a comfortable and convenient stay. Learn More Two-Bedroom Apartment Ideal for families or groups up to 4 guests, our two-bedroom units offer the convenience of separate sleeping spaces alongside a comfortable lounge. Each unit features a modern bathroom, a well-equipped kitchenette with bench-top cooking, complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, plus free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Thoughtful extras and family-friendly amenities ensure a relaxed and enjoyable stay. Learn More Previous Next About Us Welcome to the Aveda Motor Lodge. Our award-winning motel provides superb accommodation in the heart of Pukekohe and offers a range of different room types to meet every need. Super comfortable, spacious, secure and spotless clean our rooms are ideal for business or leisure, whether you are travelling on your own or as part of a group or family Conveniently located, Aveda Motor Lodge is within walking distance Pukekohe Town Centre, where you will find a variety of excellent eateries and shopping. You can easily drive to the attractions in the Fraklin District and greater Auckland area. Auckland Airport is 35 minutes, 10 minutes to the Karaka Horse Venue, 45 minutes to the Auckland CBD, and Hamilton is a mere 50 minutes away with the motorway ramps north and south only 10 minutes from the Aveda Motor Lodge. Our team is focused on supporting you to make your stay memorable. Our mission is to strive to provide the best possible guest experience √¢¬Ä¬ì we look forward to hosting you. name: avenue-motel.co.nz
homepage_content: Avenue Motel Alexandra - Home Avenue Motel Alexandra's accommodation Avenue Motel has a 4 Star Plus rating and we are proud to offer 15 high-quality units. With very competitive rates and executive style comfort, your stay with us will be enjoyable and satisfying. Alexandra is the hub of New Zealand's stone fruit and merino wool industries. Set your own pace in Central Otago. Cycle a section of the Otago Central Rail Trail, see the area from the sky, taste award-winning wines in amazing locations, try curling year-round at Nasby 45 minutes from Alexandra, play a round of golf, cruise the Clutha River, visit picturesque historic gold mining towns or just kick back and relax. Avenue Motel Alexandra is your perfect base for all these activities. Ideally situated for easy access to the town and in close proximity to many sporting facilities: the Molyneux complex, the aquatic center, an 18-hole golf course and the start of the Central Otago Rail Trail, Hamish look forward to welcoming you at the Avenue Motel, Alexandra. Motel Overview 15 spacious units (including Executive units, Spa unit, Studio units). Wheelchair accessible facilities available in two of the units. Please enquire direct. Well appointed, self-catering kitchenettes with Fridge, Microwave Oven. All units have air-conditioning/heat pumps. Roller-beds, Child porta - cots and high chairs available. Free Wifi available in all rooms ( 10 GB free ). Flat Screen TV's with SKY Guest Select 50 + Channels in all rooms. Free off-street parking. Free secure bike storage. Barbecue area. Guest laundry facilities. Walking distance to local restaurants. View more View our room types Our motel has 15 High-quality units Competitive rates and executive style comfort View more Local attractions Central Otago is New Zealand‚Äôs most inland region, also it‚Äôs hottest, coldest and driest. View more Get in touch Hamish would like to welcome you to the Avenue Motel. View more Read our guest reviews Great location We stayed here for one night, the 2 bedroom unit was spacious, has great amenities and was very clean.Full kitchen facilities & Beds comfortable. Second visit here and doesn't disappoint as one of the cleanest & well kept motels we have stay at. Would definitely stay again if needed accommodation in Alexandra. -Wendy Awesome trip Awesome awesome motel, we stayed twice over January for our friends wedding. The cleanest rooms i have ever stayed in and the banter with the owners was a real kiwi feel. So helpful, nothing eas an issue and i love how they give the wifi code straightaway. We will always stay here when we go to central otago. Thanks - AliceC Lovely room, great host A very nice room, with everything we needed. The proprieter was extremely helpful and friendly and overall this was one of the best motels we've used in our tour of New Zealand. There was a pleasant venue for dinner within a short walking distance. A lovely stay! -Wendy B Weekend trip This motel have the most comfortable King beds ever. I am fussy about sleeping in hard beds, but the owners had all the lovely things I like in a bed. Also spotless. Lovely motel, totally recommend it. Also the town has a really nice feel about it. -Shona M Excellent place to stay Stayed at this motel and was very happy with our time there. The room was very clean & tidy with everything we needed there. The room was only a single room with a bathroom but it was a big room with plenty of space. Definitely reccommend this place to anyone to stay. -gusgus Read more Photo Gallery Our beautiful Central Otago town. Visit, stay and explore for yourself... Photography by Joy Bennett Photography by Joy Bennett Photography by Joy Bennett Photography by Joy Bennett ALEXANDRA WEATHER Avenue Motel Alexandra Your Hosts: Hamish Dua | Phone: +64 3 448 6919 | Email: avenue.motel@xtra.co.nz | Address: 117 Centennial Avenue, Alexandra 9320, Central Otago ¬© 2025 - Sitemap - Admin Login - Website by GuestTraction

Quietly winning awards and creating devotees. Azabu‚Äôs menu combines Nikkei-influenced dishes and modern Japanese with an emphasis on the fun and the interesting. Quietly winning awards and creating devotees. Azabu‚Äôs menu combines Nikkei-influenced dishes and modern Japanese with an emphasis on the fun and the interesting. Learn More Previous Next About ASURE Brookvale Motel Motel Accommodation in the heart of Lake Wanaka Welcome to ASURE Brookvale Motel in Wanaka, New Zealand. Located a stone's throw away from the town center and lakefront, our quiet oasis offers fully self-contained units, making it your home away from home. Enjoy the convenience of being only 300 meters from Wanaka's lakefront and a 2 minute walk to Wanaka town centre. Relax with views of the majestic mountains and serene creek from your private balcony or garden. Each unit is equipped with full kitchen facilities, ensuite bathrooms, living area with couch, dining area, flatscreen smart tv's and complimentary WiFi available throughout the property. All units have dual heat pump air conditioning units to ensure your comfort in any season. Wanaka Golf Course is a short 5-minute walk, and the famed Puzzling World is just a 3-minute drive. Additionally, the renowned Cardrona and Treble Cone Ski Fields are a scenic 35-45 minute drive from our doorstep. name: atthai.co.nz
homepage_content: At Thai ‚Äì Queenstown's Best Thai Food Level 3, 8 Church Street, Queenstown 9348, New Zealand 4pm-Late, Closed Tues | Reservations by phone or email @ atthaiqueenstown@xtra.co.nz +64 3 442 3683 Serving fresh, exotic Thai Cuisine in the heart of Queenstown Discover Authentic Thai Cuisine in a relaxed and welcoming dining experience. @Thai delivers deliciously authentic Thai cuisine and an atmosphere that is friendly and fun for the whole family. Our authentic Thai menu balances elements of sweet and sour, salt and spice to bring the best Thai flavours to your table. Prepared by Experienced Thai Chefs We offer a range of dishes from the classic Pad Thai to Sizzling Ginger Blue Cod. In most cases we can cater to dietary needs and can make your dish vegetarian or gluten free if required. We offer a range of delicious salads, rice, noodle and tapas dishes so there is something for everyone! ORDER TAKEAWAY WITH UBER EATS A delightful Experience Come Visit Us FIND US IN CENTRAL QUEENSTOWN Level 3, 8 Church Street Queenstown 9348 New Zealand Ph. 03-442 3683 MENU FOR PHONE ORDER @ Thai Queenstown is a casual Thai eatery featuring an extensive menu of traditional curries, noodles & wok dishes. The location is very central, close to the Queenstown Wakatipu Lake front. The restaurant offering indoor and outdoor balcony seating. We also work together with local delivery services Food On Q and Uber Eats. CLICK HERE TO VIEW MENU Facebook Instagram Reservations by phone or email @ Ph. +64 3 442 3683 atthaiqueenstown@xtra.co.nz Address Level 3, 8 Church Street, Queenstown 9348, New Zealand Hours 4pm-late. name: avk.co.nz
homepage_content: Ahuriri Village Kitchen ‚Äì A fantastic new addition to the local scene The friendliest cafe/restaurant in Napier, New Zealand AVK ‚Äì Ahuriri Village Kitchen has become the go to place in the local area. The expansion and upgrades have created a warm, welcoming , fresh, relaxed environment with super friendly staff. Beautiful sea views with indoor & outdoor seating; stunning Shade7 yellow umbrellas to shade you; cozy rugs to wrap up in; sofas to lounge in, a great a la carte menu and tasty cabinet food! Pick up one of their TAKE HOME VAC PACK MEALS! Beautifully cooked Lamb Shank or Beef Cheeks. Just stunning! Ahuriri Village Kitchen is a fantastic new addition to the local scene. They have doubled in size and offer a fresh, relaxed environment with super friendly staff. Opening Hours Monday: 7:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm Tuesday: 7:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm Wednesday: 7:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm Thursday: 7:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm Friday: 7:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm Saturday: 7:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm Sunday: 7:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm Book a Table (Reservations) See our Menu Our clients say Testimonials Dorothy Guadalupe Barista We came to Ahuriri Village kitchen last week after hearing rave reviews from friends and family. The food, service and location didn't disappoint. The waiters here are lovely and deserve praise. Highly recommend, will definitely be returning. I highly recommended this place. Must try. Claire Walker Manager Had the vegan stack and a gin and tonic for lunch. The meal was delicious and fresh - though the spinach needed a good crack of salt and pepper. Generous bottles of chilled water were available by the counter. The staff were friendly, chatty and diligent. Clean and bright cafe with lovely outside area. KrisAnn Faulkner Developer Best service. Even greater food and love the atmosphere and vibe the place has. Attention to detail goes a long way with this place and loved every single moment there. Dianne T Administrator Great friendly staff and very nice food with a generous selection of cabinet food and a lot to select from the menu. Had breakfast and lunch here and can't wait till we can book in for dinner! Mary Wise Designer A very warm & friendly welcome ensuring our seating was to our liking on a balmy evening outside. A small wine & food menu but with sufficient variety to cater for our requirements. Moderate prices but fresh food cooked perfectly to our taste. Ahuriri Village Kitchen Ahuriri Village Kitchen is a fantastic new addition to the local scene. They have doubled in size and offer a fresh, relaxed environment with super friendly staff. Beautiful sea views with indoor & outdoor seating; cozy rugs to wrap up in; sofas to lounge in, a great a la carte menu and tasty cabinet food keep the locals and regulars coming back for more. A glass of local wine/beer will be the order of the day whilst dining on fresh, inventive seasonal dishes. Contact Us 6/15 HARDINGE ROAD | AHURIRI, NAPIER 4110, NEW ZEALAND +64 6-835 8950 INFO@AVK.CO.NZ Book now Date People Time Complete Select the day People + Complete your reservation 0 Item $ 0.00

homepage_content: Belgian Beer Cafe - A Tree Blog - Successfully Grow Your Fruit Trees in Auckland NZ Skip to content Menu Pruning is an essential practice in tree care that promotes healthy growth, enhances the tree‚Äôs appearance, and ensures safety by removing dead or hazardous branches. Proper pruning techniques vary depending on the type of tree and its specific needs. This article will guide you through the steps of pruning different types of trees, highlighting the importance of this practice for tree health, safety, and aesthetics. Why Prune Your Trees? Health: Regular pruning removes dead, diseased, or damaged branches, preventing the spread of disease and encouraging healthy growth. It also allows better air circulation and sunlight penetration, which are crucial for the tree‚Äôs overall health. Safety: Pruning reduces the risk of falling branches that could cause injury or property damage. It also helps maintain clearances around structures, power lines, and walkways. Aesthetics: Pruning enhances the natural shape and beauty of trees, contributing to a well-maintained and attractive landscape. When to Prune According to Tree Removal North Shore specialist Narvin who also specialise in tree pruning, The best time to prune most trees is during their dormant season, usually late winter or early spring before new growth begins. This timing minimizes stress on the tree and reduces the risk of disease and pest infestation. However, some trees, like flowering species, may require pruning immediately after they bloom. Tools You‚Äôll Need Pruning Shears: For small branches up to ¬æ inch in diameter. Lopping Shears: For branches up to 2 inches in diameter. Pruning Saw: For larger branches. Pole Pruner: For high branches that are out of reach. Protective Gear: Gloves, safety glasses, and a hard hat if necessary. Step-by-Step Pruning Guide 1. Assess the Tree Begin by examining the tree for any dead, diseased, or damaged branches. Identify branches that cross or rub against each other, as well as those that are growing inward or downward. 2. Remove Dead, Diseased, or Damaged Branches Cut these branches back to the nearest healthy branch, trunk, or main limb. Make clean cuts just outside the branch collar (the swollen area where the branch meets the trunk) to promote proper healing. 3. Thin Out Crowded Branches Selectively remove branches to allow better light penetration and air circulation. Focus on removing branches that cross or rub against each other, as well as those that grow towards the center of the tree. 4. Trim for Shape and Structure For young trees, establish a strong central leader (the main upward-growing branch) and remove competing leaders. Shape the tree to maintain a balanced, natural form. For mature trees, maintain their shape by removing any wayward or overly long branches. 5. Make Proper Cuts When removing a branch, use the three-cut method to prevent bark tearing: Make the first cut on the underside of the branch, about 6-12 inches from the trunk. Make the second cut on the top side of the branch, a few inches beyond the first cut, to remove the branch. Make the final cut just outside the branch collar to remove the remaining stub. 6. Avoid Over-Pruning Never remove more than 25% of a tree‚Äôs canopy in a single year. Over-pruning can stress the tree and make it more susceptible to disease and pests. Pruning Techniques for Different Types of Trees Deciduous Trees Prune in late winter to early spring. Focus on removing dead, diseased, and damaged branches. Shape the tree by thinning crowded branches and maintaining a balanced form. Evergreen Trees Prune in late winter or early spring before new growth begins. Remove dead or damaged branches. Lightly shape the tree by trimming back any overgrown branches. Flowering Trees Prune immediately after flowering if they bloom in spring. For summer-blooming trees, prune in late winter or early spring. Remove spent flowers and any dead or diseased branches to encourage new growth. Fruit Trees Prune in late winter or early spring while the tree is still dormant. Focus on removing any dead or diseased wood. Thin out the canopy to improve air circulation and sunlight penetration, which promotes fruit production. Final Thoughts Proper pruning is vital for the health, safety, and aesthetics of your trees. By following these steps and using the right techniques, you can ensure your trees grow strong , look beautiful, and remain safe for years to come. Regular pruning not only enhances the natural beauty of your landscape but also prevents potential hazards, making it a crucial aspect of tree care. For those unsure about tackling tree pruning themselves, consider hiring a professional arborist. They have the expertise and equipment to prune trees safely and effectively, ensuring your trees receive the best care possible. Remember, a well-pruned tree is a happy and healthy tree! ‚Ä¶ Once the most suitable fruit tree has been chosen, other equally important questions come to mind in terms of its maintenance, questions that we intend to help you solve in this article by giving you useful advice on planting, pruning, disease prevention and pests . Land preparation For the planting to be a success, it is better to be a bit proactive and a month in advance make a hole of at least 1 m in diameter and 80 cm deep, to later fill it again, taking advantage of to enrich the soil with a bottom fertilizer like worm castings. If in the first years it is going to be necessary to fix the fruit tree to a guide, it would be convenient to place the frame or tutor before filling the holes or trenches made with earth to soften the ground and improve its quality and aeration. Planting fruit trees from a pot The appropriate time for planting is the one in which there will no longer be any risks of frost that prevent sprouting and the formation of new roots. The steps to follow would be: Dig a hole slightly larger than the root ball Immerse the root ball in a container with water so that the root ball substrate is thoroughly moistened before removing it from the pot Insert the root ball at the bottom of the hole, ensuring that the top of the root ball is flush with the ground Fill the hole without tamping the dirt Make a tree hole around the trunk with a hoe and water abundantly Prune the master branches one third to balance the aerial part (crown) with the underground part (roots) Winter pruning One of the most decisive maintenance tasks in obtaining a good harvest and which is given less importance is pruning, which is very necessary in trees already established every 4 or 5 years, since it is a way to rejuvenate the tree and favor the formation of new shoots. The best time to perform this task is in November , when the tree is entering vegetative rest. Fertilization Fruit trees are one of the crops that consume the most nutrients, so in addition to making a fertilizer during the spring and the time of fruit formation with a specific fertilizer for fruit trees, a previous fertilization with abundant organic matter with manure, compost or earthworm humus, which would be applied to the foot of the tree up to the vertical of the branches, in late winter immediately before vegetative development begins. Padding A practice that will help us considerably is the application of organic mulch, a layer of at least 5 cm deep, of straw, cut grass or pine bark, which when distributed at the foot of the tree will limit the growth of weeds and it will also maintain a degree of moisture beneficial to the superficial roots.‚Ä¶ Search for: Search Terms and Conditions - Privacy Policy

name: ciciocacio.co.nz
homepage_content: Italian Restaurant - Cicio Cacio Osteria Newtown Skip to content A me piacciono gli anfratti bui delle osterie dormienti, dove la gente culmina nell‚Äôeccesso del canto. A me piacciono le cose bestemmiate e leggere, e i calici di vino profondi. ‚ÄúI like dark crannies of sleeping osterie, where people culminate in the excess of singing. I like cursed and light things, and deep glasses of wine." Our Story ‚ÄúIt was something like ten or eleven years ago. I was lost and lonely, working as a cook, living in an old motel (The Carillon) in Mount Cook in Wellington, and trying to be a writer. I didn‚Äôt have time or will for washing my clothes at the motel, so every Monday on my day off I would walk to Newtown, leave my stuff at a laundry nearby and go to have a coffee at Baobab caf√©. There was an eatery called Manon at the back of an alleyway in front of the cafe. I would spy the restaurant from the little window thinking how cute it was. Manon eventually closed down and the place seemed to be abandoned for years. The place looked as old as it could be in Europe, and decadent and bohemian as all the things I loved. Few years went by and life took over. I married a beautiful Chilean girl who used to cook with me and call me ‚Äúdictator!‚Äù, I learned to speak Spanish like a Chilean, I stopped writing bull‚Ä¶ and I got into running some Italian kitchen in town at Mariluca first and then Ombra. Then my friend Luis who runs Viva Mexico next door, passed me the contact of the landlord of that old place in Newtown. The landlord was an old man in an old house in Oriental Bay. He loved that restaurant more than anything he had and he always dreamt to bring it back to life, before it was too late. My wife Patricia, my former business partner and I opened the place with $16.000 dollars, with a name that nobody could pronounce, going against any common sense business rules and with no much hope to survive. We started serving two lonely house made sausages on an empty plate, pouring only Italian wines, and writing menus in Italian. People thought we were nice guys, but won‚Äôt make it. And here we are, five years later, celebrating every day the same love for good people, honest food and true wines.‚Äù (Giulio Ricatti ‚Äì chef patron) A CULINARY JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF ITALY... By being an ‚Äúosteria‚Äù we mean that at Cicio Cacio we cook humble Italian food in a family environment. We are passionate about Italian regional cuisine and we pretend to travel the whole peninsula, researching Italian lost recipes. We change the menu every month, following a different city of Italy. If we can do something by hand we will do it, as our famous bread, pasta and sausages. Our goal is to be as authentic as it would be the food you eat at home in Italy. We try to look closer at ingredients, places, people and memories. Our language is the language of simplicity, treated with care and respect. All our dishes, wines and menus are in Italian because Italy is what our ‚Äúosteria‚Äù is about. We invite you to enjoy the trip. Buon Appetito!! the art of wine As for our food, our wine list reflects our travels through Italy and our passion for mysterious and exotic grapes. As home of something like 500 different varieties, Italy is probably the most interesting wine producer in the world. We love our wines and we love our people, and we try to match the two things. Are you a student? Are you an artist? Are you an intellectual, a housewife or a businessman? Are you young or old? Man or female? Poor or rich? We try to have wines for everyone. We like wines that express Italy at its best, keeping the subject easy and democratic. As every other art (or craft) it is a simple thing, really. It is not a headache. It is a pleasure. Drink List Cicio Cacio is not only a restaurant, it is our home. We will light candles and fire, pour wine and play music. As Baudelaire would have said: ‚ÄúWe will boil and serve our own heart‚Äù. homepage_content: Jax Burger Shack Home Our Story Order Now Contact Us FROM OUR FAMILY TO YOURS ORDER NOW ON THE MENU ORDER NOW OUR STORY It all kicked off in a quiet street in Manurewa, where our founder was flipping burgers out of a run-down fish and chip shop - and turning it into the talk of the town. They renamed the shop Smokys' Manurewa. Word spread fast, especially on social media, and soon people were cruising in from every corner of Auckland just to get a taste. After parting ways with his original business partner, our founder set out to build something truly his own. That's how Jax Burger Shack was born in 2020. These days, he's running Jax alongside his wife, keeping it a true family business, with our motto front and centre: "Burgers from our family to yours." And trust us - expansion is definitely on the horizon. We're obsessed with quality, no shortcuts taken. We've got beautiful buns baked fresh for us on the regular, juicy tender patties made instore, and our own house-made aioli that takes every bite to the next level. Even our sides are cooked in rich beef tallow for that extra punch of flavour. Come hungry - your satisfaction is our priority. Because at Jax Burger Shack, we're setting the gold standard for burgers, one epic feed at a time. FOLLOW US ON SOCIALS LOCATIONS At Jax, we're all about bringing people together over seriously great food. Whether you're rolling in with the crew or flying solo, there√¢¬Ä¬ôs always a seat for you and a vibe that feels unmistakably Kiwi. From our stacked burgers to crunchy sides, it√¢¬Ä¬ôs the kind of place you√¢¬Ä¬ôll want to come back to - again and again. name: kitchenette.co.nz
homepage_content: Modern Kitchenettes For Small Spaces | Kitchenette NZ by Plumbob ‚Äì Kitchenette By Plumbob Skip to content Search Reset Search Load slide 1 of 4 Load slide 2 of 4 Load slide 3 of 4 Load slide 4 of 4 Pause slideshow Play slideshow Floating Kitchenette redefines space A bold new direction in compact kitchen design has launched. Discover The Floating range, a customisable pre-wired and pre-plumbed kitchenette with optional appliances that can be installed in just one hour. explore floating range Kitchenettes are created with simplicity at their core, using locally sourced products and materials in New Zealand The complete package is specified with quality Panasonic and Robinhood appliances, pre-wired and pre-plumbed. The finished product will be fully or mostly assembled in our East Tamaki factory and delivered to your door, saving you time and money. Simple. No two spaces are the same, so your choices are many and varied. Kitchenettes allow you to change configurations, add a pantry, a washer/dryer combo, a large fridge or extra storage. Even the splashbacks have a wide range of colour options. Specify to your requirements. Simple. Your alternative? A flat pack kitchenette. Not simple. View Kitchenettes Explore the kitchenette range Compact Wall Units Regular Wall Units Extended Wall Units Compact Counter Units Regular Counter Units Extended Counter Units Load slide 1 of 3 Load slide 2 of 3 Load slide 3 of 3 Pause slideshow Play slideshow DESIGNS AND MODELS TO FIT ANY SMALL SPACE Our modern kitchenettes can be supplied as counter- or wall-mounted models. The wall-mounted models have additional storage above the benchtop and can include a rangehood and microwave. Each size offers a variety of models with preconfigured appliance combinations. Simply select a model that best fits your space and has the necessary appliances and functionality. IDEAL FOR: Garages, sheds and cabins Rumpus rooms and man caves Granny flats and sleep outs Shipping containers Tiny homes and dwellings Retail stores and small business kitchens Hotels, motels and apartments Social housing and aged care facilities ‚úî Top Quality Appliances Our kitchenettes use locally sourced Panasonic and Robinhood appliances, which come with standard manufacturer warranties. Cooktops, range hoods, fridges, dishwashers, ovens, microwaves, and trim kits are pre-installed to ensure a perfect fit. To prevent potential freight damage, some appliances are repackaged for transportation. The all-in-one kitchenette concept provides exceptional value for money. ‚úî Fast installation Compact and Regular kitchenettes can be set up in just 60 minutes, including the supplied appliances and necessary electrical and plumbing components, saving you time and money. Electrical and plumbing connections require registered tradespeople. Certificates of Compliance (COCs) are essential for warranties to be valid. ‚úî Simple electrical connection Our unique power board is a standard kitchenette feature. A single junction box and wiring loom feed the pre-fitted double power outlets, ready for your electrician to terminate on-site. Components are locally sourced and come with an electrical declaration of conformity. All models have two power outlets above the bench for your kettle, toaster or coffee machine. ‚úî Simple plumbing setup The sink, waste basket, and sink overflow are installed on the benchtop. The mixer tap, waste pipe, and P-trap are pre-fitted and then removed for transport. If your kitchenette includes a dishwasher, the P-trap will have the proper discharge connection. Our dishwashers come equipped with an aqua-stop inlet hose. A registered plumber must complete all water and wastewater connections. ‚úî Fully or mostly assembled Depending on the size of your kitchenette and access to your property, we can deliver it fully assembled. Larger units arrive mostly assembled. We'll provide the necessary assembly instructions, hardware, and specialised connector tools. With on-site services in place and tradies on hand, you could be cooking in just 60 minutes. ‚úî Nationwide delivery We have extensive experience shipping kitchenettes and glass display cases throughout the country. Our trusted providers will deliver your kitchenette to its final location anywhere in New Zealand. Need something more Custom? We can help you to design a kitchenette that perfectly fits your style and space. Contact our design team to get started today. Contact us New Zealand Made Our kitchen cabinets are proudly designed and manufactured in New Zealand with quality materials, components and appliances. Sustainable Materials We develop all our products with sustainability in mind, using materials sourced from certified Environmental Choice suppliers across New Zealand. Certified Environmental Choice Our certified environmental choice suppliers include: Bestwood, Prime Panels, Daiken, Southland Ltd and New Zealand Panels Ltd. what our clients say ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ I recently had the pleasure of purchasing a ready-made kitchenette from Kitchenette by Plumbob, and I am absolutely thrilled with the result! After spending considerable time comparing pricing for flat-packed units from Mitre 10 and Bunnings, I decided to go with a pre-assembled, professionally installed unit, and it was definitely the right choice. The quality of the unit is outstanding‚Äîevery detail is meticulously crafted, and the fittings are top-notch. The delivery was prompt, arriving exactly when expected, and the installation was smooth and hassle-free. The customer service throughout the process was exceptional, with the team keeping me informed every step of the way and addressing any questions I had. I couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with my decision to invest in this unit, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a high-quality, well-made kitchenette. Michelle Brown | Director | REEL Direct Limited ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ We have received and installed several Kitchenettes to date for our Aged Care Facilities in the far North. Kitchenette‚Äôs save time, being delivered mostly assembled. The inclusion of appliances and pre-fitted electrical and plumbing components make life easy. My team had the kitchenettes fully assembled and in position within an hour due to pre-assembly, electrical pre-fitting and plumbing. I can fully recommend Kitchenette throughout the entire process. Paul Newman | Far North District Council ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ I needed a small kitchen area for a hair salon. The size was exactly what we needed. Manufactured and delivered in a timely fashion. I love the fact that everything was included... microwave, fridge, power points and sink with tap and plumbing/electrical all included. Highly recommend. name: motuekaindian.co.nz
homepage_content: Simply Indian, delicious Indian food in Motueka BOOKINGS & TAKEAWAYS: 03 528 6364 TAKEAWAY MENU ORDER ONLINE - CLICK & COLLECT Simply Indian Restaurant & Take-away, Motueka Motueka's Indian Restaurant NAMASTE! And welcome to Simply Indian Simply Indian has been serving fine Indian cuisine for over twenty years to Motueka's locals and many visitors. Mouth-watering authentic Indian dishes, prepared by trained and experienced Indian chefs, for you to relish and enjoy. Not forgetting an ice cold Kingfisher to get your meal off to a good start. Our bar has a good selection of wines and soft drinks too. So after a hard days work or a trip into the Abel Tasman come and see Sabin and all the staff - they look forward to welcoming you. Simply Indian, the original Motueka Indian restaurant We're now over 20 years old. "I started work here 10 years ago in front of house as duty manager, and commuted from Nelson every day. I loved coming to work in Motueka and chatting with all the regulars and tourist visitors from far and wide. One day the opportunity to buy the restaurant came up and I jumped at the idea. I liked Motueka, the restaurant and its beautiful clientele so much that I bought it. And so I became the very proud owner of Simply Indian. I had just started a family and we moved to Motueka straight-away to be closer to our new venture. Two of the chefs from those days are the main stay of our kitchen still, ensuring you receive consistent quality dining every time you visit us. You might find cheaper but I'm confident you won't find better quality and taste. Thanks to everyone who dines with us, you have kept us going through the ups and downs that life throws our way." Sabin Lunch: 11am-2pm (5 days, Mon-Sat, closed Tuesday lunchtime) Dinner: from 5pm till late (7 days) Fully licensed & BYO - corkage fee: - $10 Great choice of vegetarian and vegan dishes Banquets & parties, dinner for two, a group of friends or a Friday shout with your work mates. It's best at Simply Indian in Motueka. Dining in? We recommend booking to avoid disappointment. NO surcharge on public holidays. CCTV is used on our premises to keep our staff and customers safe. Find Us Phone: 03 528 6364 Website By WeDoWebsites

GATHER OFTEN... 10 Clarendon St, North Dunedin Tues - Sat 12 til Late Closed Sunday/Monday *can consider large bookings on Sunday/Monday barmanager@ombrellos.co.nz WHO WE ARE Ombrellos Kitchen + Bar is a well established, treasured and much loved Dunedin restaurant and bar. ‚Äã We are proud to be Dunedin's premium craft beer restaurant with at least 12 every changing craft beers on tap at all times! ‚Äã Ombrellos is a place built on community, awesome staff, delicious food and an ever changing, top notch selection of craft beers - can you see why we all love it so much..? With an epic bar, quirky restaurant, cosy private dining rooms and an outdoor courtyard - Ombrellos has something to offer everyone from kids to adults to furry friends and everything in between! Our Spaces WHAT WE DO Ombrellos is a special place that can adapt personally to each and every occasion. Whether you're after the perfect back drop for long lunches, after work drinks, private functions or cosy get togethers over lunch, brunch, dinner or drinks we'll have you sorted. ‚Äã We are well known for live music most Friday's, along with special food + beer events across the year - always keep an eye on our social media for whats coming up next! homepage_content: Home - Oakura School Kia √Ñ¬Åkona te manako me te manaaki Learning to Think, Learning to Care Oakura School is a vibrant full primary school (year 1-8) of approximately 380 students. The school is nestled between the Kaitake Ranges and the beautiful Oakura Beach. Our dedicated and caring staff, supportive community and rich learning environment, combine to create unique opportunities for our students. Oakura School students learn to think and learn to care, in a learning community which prepares them for a successful future. name: primadeli.co.nz
homepage_content: Prima Deli | Fresh. Ready to Eat. top of page HEALTHY MADE EASY At Prima Deli, we believe that amazing lunches start with amazing ingredients. That‚Äôs why we place such a strong emphasis on freshness, quality, and balance in everything we make. From freshly baked breads and premium meats and cheeses to crisp seasonal produce, every item is carefully chosen to create meals that are as nourishing as they are delicious. Our range is designed to suit a wide variety of tastes and occasions. Choose from classic sandwiches, hearty subs, wholesome wraps, flavour-packed sushi, and convenient ‚Äúheat to eat‚Äù options ‚Äî all crafted to deliver maximum flavour with minimum fuss. Whether you‚Äôre after something light and refreshing, or filling and satisfying, ‚Äã We‚Äôre proud to offer food that combines the wholesome goodness Kiwis love with the convenience today‚Äôs busy lifestyles demand ‚Äî without ever compromising on freshness or taste. 100% FRESH You can enjoy Prima Deli products at service stations, supermarkets, airlines, and selected caf√©s right across New Zealand ‚Äî making it easy to grab something fresh and satisfying wherever your day takes you. From quick on-the-go lunches to light bites while you travel, our ready-to-eat range is designed to fit seamlessly into busy Kiwi lifestyles. If you‚Äôre interested in stocking Prima Deli, we‚Äôd love to work with you. We offer flexible delivery options, competitive pricing, and a wide product range tailored to suit different markets and customer preferences. Our team can provide product information, order forms, and support to make the process simple and efficient. TALK WITH US CATERING Let Prima Deli take the stress out of catering your next school/sports/community event, lunch, meeting, event, or celebration. Our team can provide packaged products or prepare beautifully presented platters and trays featuring our signature fresh sandwiches, sushi, wraps, and other ready-to-enjoy options from our catering menu. Whether you‚Äôre hosting events, colleagues, friends, or family, we‚Äôll make sure the food is as memorable as the occasion. Because we focus on quality and freshness, all catering orders are prepared to order. A minimum of three weekdays‚Äô notice helps us ensure your food is made with the finest ingredients and delivered at its freshest. OUR STORY At Prima Deli, food is family. Since 2000, we‚Äôve been committed to bringing New Zealanders ready-to-eat convenience meals that combine freshness you can trust with quality you can rely on every day. Prima Deli began with a simple idea: to fill the gap in the market for deli-style, ready-to-eat sandwiches and wholesome foods that taste as good as they look. Built on the back of our very popular Chic-A-Dee brand, from day one Prima Deli has been focused on honest freshness, wholesome goodness, exceptional flavour, and guaranteed food safety ‚Äî values that continue to guide everything we do. All of our products are crafted from our purpose-built facilities in Christchurch and Auckland servicing South and North Islands with prime natural ingredients, responsible packaging, stringent quality controls, and high service levels. We believe good food should be effortless, so we design our range to suit the broad Kiwi palate while meeting today‚Äôs demand for convenience, safety, quality and price. Behind the scenes, we continually invest in modern equipment and technology, and innovative processes to ensure every item we make is consistent, safe, and fresh. From seasonal menu updates to swift market response, our team works hard to stay ahead while never compromising on taste. Our dedicated team is the secret ingredient in every product we make, for you to enjoy. Over two decades later, Prima Deli has grown into a benchmark name in New Zealand‚Äôs ready-to-eat market, trusted by consumers across the country. And as we like to say ‚Äî the proof is in the eating. bottom of page

Our team can provide product information, order forms, and support to make the process simple and efficient. TALK WITH US CATERING Let Prima Deli take the stress out of catering your next school/sports/community event, lunch, meeting, event, or celebration. Our team can provide packaged products or prepare beautifully presented platters and trays featuring our signature fresh sandwiches, sushi, wraps, and other ready-to-enjoy options from our catering menu. Whether you‚Äôre hosting events, colleagues, friends, or family, we‚Äôll make sure the food is as memorable as the occasion. Because we focus on quality and freshness, all catering orders are prepared to order. A minimum of three weekdays‚Äô notice helps us ensure your food is made with the finest ingredients and delivered at its freshest. OUR STORY At Prima Deli, food is family. Since 2000, we‚Äôve been committed to bringing New Zealanders ready-to-eat convenience meals that combine freshness you can trust with quality you can rely on every day. Prima Deli began with a simple idea: to fill the gap in the market for deli-style, ready-to-eat sandwiches and wholesome foods that taste as good as they look. Built on the back of our very popular Chic-A-Dee brand, from day one Prima Deli has been focused on honest freshness, wholesome goodness, exceptional flavour, and guaranteed food safety ‚Äî values that continue to guide everything we do. All of our products are crafted from our purpose-built facilities in Christchurch and Auckland servicing South and North Islands with prime natural ingredients, responsible packaging, stringent quality controls, and high service levels. We believe good food should be effortless, so we design our range to suit the broad Kiwi palate while meeting today‚Äôs demand for convenience, safety, quality and price. Behind the scenes, we continually invest in modern equipment and technology, and innovative processes to ensure every item we make is consistent, safe, and fresh. From seasonal menu updates to swift market response, our team works hard to stay ahead while never compromising on taste. Our dedicated team is the secret ingredient in every product we make, for you to enjoy. Over two decades later, Prima Deli has grown into a benchmark name in New Zealand‚Äôs ready-to-eat market, trusted by consumers across the country. And as we like to say ‚Äî the proof is in the eating. bottom of page

name: townchip.co.nz
homepage_content: Hokitika Townchip 0 SKIP THE QUEUE ORDER ONLINE THE LOCAL TOWN CHIPPERY A KICK ASS ARRAY OF FAST FOOD KAI ORDER ONLINE and we‚Äôll text you when your order is ready - easy as! Want to score a free scoop? Join our Frequent Fryer Loyalty Club today SIGN UP TRY SOMTHING FISHY Rig Where the term ‚Äòshark ‚Äòn‚Äô taties‚Äô comes from. Rig belongs to the Triakidae family - a group of houndsharks / ground sharks. They‚Äòre Jaw‚Äôs little cousin - so while you won‚Äòt need a bigger boat, you‚Äôre deffo gonna need a bigger stomach. A prized fish & chip shop fav it is a firm, white, boneless fish with low oil content. Freshly fried Rig can initiate a feeding frenzy. Elephant A fish & chip superstar. Elephant Fish have firm white flesh with low oil content - they belong to the same group as sharks and rays so there are no bones, only cartilage. Despite the kind expression in their eyes, they won‚Äôt be coming to a Disney movie near you, specifically because of their very disturbing nose thingy. Luckily they taste better than they look! Blue Cod Blue Cod are indigenous to New Zealand and are common in colder waters South of the Cook Strait and around the Chatham Islands. The Codfather of the fish and chip world... Highly prized for its mild, slightly sweet taste. It is best enjoyed battered and washed down with a nice tipple. AND Blue Cod being bottom dwellers it‚Äôs more than fitting to say... ‚ÄúBottom‚Äôs Up!‚Äù ORDER NOW ‚ÄúThe Townchip is the best! Great burgers, and funny fishreviews on the wallpaper. So good!‚Äù ‚Äì Caz, Frequent Fryer Read More Reviews
