name: urbaneatery.co.nz
homepage_content: Nelson Restaurant and Bar - Urban Eatery Welcome to Urban Eatery Restaurant and Bar in Nelson! Don‚Äôt be afraid to put your elbows on the table and engage us and your fellow diners. Get to know us and what‚Äôs inspiring us today. We‚Äôll be delivering the food we‚Äôre currently passionate about on each plate we serve, sourced from local suppliers. We hope you come with a curious spirit! RESERVATIONS Bookings are available for lunch and dinner for dining purposes only. Don't worry however, we'll be keeping some tables free for those of you who like to fly by the seat of your pants and have some drinks and nibbles! BOOK NOW MENU Our menu changes regularly with respect to what we are into at the moment, whether it‚Äôs an ingredient, band, chef or current event. Our goal is to make everyone feel like whanau (family) ‚Äì whether it is your first or fortieth time. We believe that serving up good juju in a restaurant isn‚Äôt just in the food and drink, but in the attitude and atmosphere which will make Urban the perfect place to stop in and refuel. VIEW MENU OYSTERS ROCK!! We‚Äôre truly lucky to be surrounded by amazing food producers who help make us look good. Thanks to Te Matuku, Te Kouma and Marlborough for our amazing oysters, waiting to be freshly shucked for you to enjoy and served in our Oyster Bar ... don't like oysters?? All good we've got you covered, heaps of other yummy dishes to choose from! SUP FROM THE BAR Aside from great craft beer and a modest but outstanding wine list, we think we do a pretty mean cocktail. Somewhere in the world it‚Äôs cocktail hour. BOOKINGS You are now able to book for both lunch and dinner, with reservations available for groups of up to 10 diners. GIFT VOUCHERS Gift vouchers are available online, instantly! If you would prefer a physical voucher (instead of a digital one) pop in and see us at 274 Hardy Street and the team will be happy to help out! TREAT SOMEONE!

name: aromaindia.co.nz
homepage_content: Aroma India Greytown Restaurant & Takeaway Welcome To Aroma India Greytown Open 6 Days from Tuesday to Sunday ORDER ONLINE BOOK TABLE Welcome To Aroma India Greytown Best place for Family and Friends ORDER ONLINE BOOK TABLE Welcome To Aroma India Greytown Pop in to see the restaurant in action and pick-up your orders ORDER ONLINE BOOK TABLE THE BEST TRADITIONAL INDIAN RESTAURANT Pick Up Delivery Table Booking AROMA OUR DELICIOUS FOOD AT YOUR HOME Check our Menu Who We Are About Us My wife and I have worked in the hospitality industry for many years. We opened in Greytown in 2015 and focused on providing a friendly, welcoming atmosphere in which our diners can enjoy our fabulous food served by our knowledgeable staff. We then opened Aroma India Silverstream in January 2018 and Aroma India Martinborough in July 2021. Our Food We serve innovative, fresh meals cooked to order which is why you sometimes have to wait for your meals to be ready. We mix our own spices in-house rather than using ready-mixed packets to help contribute to the freshness of our food. We also make our own paneer in-house as you will be able to tell from the √¢¬Ä¬úsqueaks√¢¬Ä¬ù it makes when you eat it. All of these factors contribute to the √¢¬Ä¬úAroma India flavour√¢¬Ä¬ù. Private Function Over the years, we have seen many celebrations and we are happy to cater to large groups and allow the restaurant to be decorated within reason. If you are bringing young children that need to be given something to eat quickly, please us know and we will do our best to help you to get them settled so that you can all enjoy your evening. ORDER ONLINE NOW Customer Reviews Listen to what our customers say about us Karen √¢¬Ä¬úWe LOVE Aroma India. The food is always fabulous and the service friendly. The restaurant has a nice modern feel to it and does not feel crowded even when full. We are never hurried when we are there and feel that we can take our time eating. Although I√¢¬Ä¬ôm not a vegetarian, some of my favourite dishes are the paneer, the mushrooms and the dal makhani. I also love the Hariayala Murgh. The portions are a good size, particularly the biryanis. The chefs are very approachable and happy to show-off the kitchen.√¢¬Ä¬ù Rob √¢¬Ä¬ú√¢¬Ä¬úComing from the UK and being local in Greytown, we were very excited about a new Indian Restaurant in our town. When we tried it and found it to be consistently the best curry in New Zealand, we were blown away. We can definitely recommend our favourite dishes which are Hariayala Murgh and Malabari Fish.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chris √¢¬Ä¬úWith the arrival of √¢¬Ä¬úAroma√¢¬Ä¬ù, Greytown can now boast as having the best Indian Restaurant in the Lower North Island. The ambience and style is warm and inviting, the staff always attentive friendly and happy. The menu is wide and varied but must-try dishes are the Garlic Chicken Tikka, the Hariayala Murgh, Lamb Masala and the Chicken Korma. After several visits, it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always a great feeling that the staff recognise you and always make you feel special. Dining-in or taking-out, nothing is an issue, and home delivery is always a massive bonus on cold winter nights!! √¢¬Ä¬ú Maureen √¢¬Ä¬úOne of the best Indian restaurants in the Wellington region. My husband and I go there several times a month for lunch or dinner as the menu is extensive, authentic, and the staff is exceedingly friendly and attentive. Dishes can be made to-order and Aroma has one of the best combination of spices, sauces, and fresh ingredients. An added bonus, we have taken our young Grandchildren there on occasion and they too are made to feel equally welcome. I highly recommend Aroma for anyone wanting a great Indian meal!√¢¬Ä¬ù Colin √¢¬Ä¬úBefore dining at aroma india I√¢¬Ä¬ôd had Indian food half-a-dozen times but found its a little dry and not to my taste. We moved to Greytown 2 years ago and my wife asked me to try Aroma India. I found the restaurant to be clean and inviting, and the owner and staff pleasant and eager to chat. I now love Indian food √¢¬Ä¬ì it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always fresh and very tasty. My favourite is their chicken khorma (medium) with their delicious garlic naan. We like to eat there once a week. The first time we went there we asked for ice in our wine √¢¬Ä¬ì strange but true! The second time they remembered us and asked if we would like ice! AMAZING! GREAT STAFF, GREAT FOOD.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chelle √¢¬Ä¬úAroma has added some delicious spice to our life! We love trying something new each visit and appreciate being able to specify the level of spice. The hariyala murgh is delicious.√¢¬Ä¬ù Previous Next LOCATION 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand 06 304 8080 069298209 aromaindia38@gmail.com Phone 06 304 8080, 069298209 Email aromaindia03@gmail.com Location 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712 ‚Üë

Although I√¢¬Ä¬ôm not a vegetarian, some of my favourite dishes are the paneer, the mushrooms and the dal makhani. I also love the Hariayala Murgh. The portions are a good size, particularly the biryanis. The chefs are very approachable and happy to show-off the kitchen.√¢¬Ä¬ù Rob √¢¬Ä¬ú√¢¬Ä¬úComing from the UK and being local in Greytown, we were very excited about a new Indian Restaurant in our town. When we tried it and found it to be consistently the best curry in New Zealand, we were blown away. We can definitely recommend our favourite dishes which are Hariayala Murgh and Malabari Fish.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chris √¢¬Ä¬úWith the arrival of √¢¬Ä¬úAroma√¢¬Ä¬ù, Greytown can now boast as having the best Indian Restaurant in the Lower North Island. The ambience and style is warm and inviting, the staff always attentive friendly and happy. The menu is wide and varied but must-try dishes are the Garlic Chicken Tikka, the Hariayala Murgh, Lamb Masala and the Chicken Korma. After several visits, it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always a great feeling that the staff recognise you and always make you feel special. Dining-in or taking-out, nothing is an issue, and home delivery is always a massive bonus on cold winter nights!! √¢¬Ä¬ú Maureen √¢¬Ä¬úOne of the best Indian restaurants in the Wellington region. My husband and I go there several times a month for lunch or dinner as the menu is extensive, authentic, and the staff is exceedingly friendly and attentive. Dishes can be made to-order and Aroma has one of the best combination of spices, sauces, and fresh ingredients. An added bonus, we have taken our young Grandchildren there on occasion and they too are made to feel equally welcome. I highly recommend Aroma for anyone wanting a great Indian meal!√¢¬Ä¬ù Colin √¢¬Ä¬úBefore dining at aroma india I√¢¬Ä¬ôd had Indian food half-a-dozen times but found its a little dry and not to my taste. We moved to Greytown 2 years ago and my wife asked me to try Aroma India. I found the restaurant to be clean and inviting, and the owner and staff pleasant and eager to chat. I now love Indian food √¢¬Ä¬ì it√¢¬Ä¬ôs always fresh and very tasty. My favourite is their chicken khorma (medium) with their delicious garlic naan. We like to eat there once a week. The first time we went there we asked for ice in our wine √¢¬Ä¬ì strange but true! The second time they remembered us and asked if we would like ice! AMAZING! GREAT STAFF, GREAT FOOD.√¢¬Ä¬ù Chelle √¢¬Ä¬úAroma has added some delicious spice to our life! We love trying something new each visit and appreciate being able to specify the level of spice. The hariyala murgh is delicious.√¢¬Ä¬ù Previous Next LOCATION 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand 06 304 8080 069298209 aromaindia38@gmail.com Phone 06 304 8080, 069298209 Email aromaindia03@gmail.com Location 74-76 Main Street, Greytown 5712 ‚Üë

name: decksofpaihia.co.nz
homepage_content: Paihia Bed and Breakfast Accommodation - Bay of Islands NZ Find out more Luxury Boutique Accommodation in Paihia, Bay of Islands Decks of Paihia offers purpose built boutique luxury bed and breakfast accommodation in our comfortable home. The property has undergone a stylish refurbishment in July 2020. Set on the hill in a secluded sunny north facing position, overlooking central Paihia and the immediate Bay. Daily breakfast is included in your rate and is served in our communal guest dining room with views overlooking the bay. Beautiful sun-drenched decks offer several vantage points to enjoy the vista. In ground swimming pool located outside the guest rooms offers a sunny, private and secluded area to relax and enjoy the solitude and beautiful bird life in the adjacent native bush. Decks of Paihia is also only a couple of minutes‚Äô drive from the centre of Paihia and the wharf and maritime area. An easy downhill stroll will have you in the village centre in 10 minutes. All guest rooms have ensuite bathrooms and are stylishly furnished for maximum comfort . Refurbished to a high standard in July 2020 . Email Us: info@decksofpaihia.com Tel: +64 9 402 6146 or +64 21 278 7558 or +64 21 030 4427 FREE WIFI DAILY BREAKFAST INCLUDED GUEST POOL CENTRAL LOCATION Meet Your Hosts Phil and Wendy Hopkinson have been living in the Bay of Islands for 27 years, moving north from Auckland in 1994. At this time we designed and built a backpackers lodge which we operated successfully until 2001. Our love of travelling and swapping stories with our guests enabled us to meet some wonderful people and has led us to develop and build our new home containing boutique guest accommodation. We opened Decks of Paihia in 2005 and we love to share our home and extensive knowledge of Northland and New Zealand with those who come to stay. We look forward to your visit. Both Phil and Wendy are fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and would respectfully request that our guests are also. ‚Äì Phil and Wendy Phil & Wendy are happy to offer complimentary transport to/from Paihia village if you are travelling without a car. Transfers to/from Kerikeri Airport are available with the local taxi shuttle services. We recommend Super Shuttles . Facebook Instagram LinkedIn Pinterest

name: littleturkishcafe.com
homepage_content: Little Turkish Cafe Skip to content New Menu Items Coming Soon! Auckland's Best Turkish Cuisine! 217 KARANGAHAPE ROAD, AUCKLAND Item added to your cart View cart Check out Continue shopping SERVING OVER 30 YEARS OF TURKISH FLAVOUR! I have been coming here for 20+ years. I live overseas now, and every time I visit Auckland I have to come back. The absolute best kebabs. The way the meat is marinated and cut is just perfect. Delicious. Rosa A go-to place for kebabs on K-road. Great value chicken kebab on rice with garlic yoghurt, a healthy salad with nice humus as a dressing. There are plenty of options for customisation, and the service is quick and efficient. Alex Marvelous service with stunning interior. My partner and I had lunch here and everything is 5/5. Highly recommended. Will return soon. Jayce I had an amazing experience at little Turkish cafe, Mahdi and surya were amazing help. Incredible experience best kebab I‚Äôve ever had will recommend for all my friends and family. I love how the lamb is proper cuts of meat and not mince. Highly recommend incredible service. Vicey The vegetarian moussaka was out of this world. Awesome comfort food and the portion size was huge. I almost didn‚Äôt have room for baklava, which was delicious, too. A casual space to go have a satisfying meal. My friend got chicken skewers and commented they were cooked to perfection. S Stumbled across this awesome little cafe in Auckland during my weekend stay. We ordered the lamb on chips and a meatlovers pizza. The food was very good quality and tasted delicious. The pizza's are woodfired and it was perfectly done. The lamb on chips/lamb snack pack was also very tasty and filling. Thank you very much! Darlo This place is great. I got stuck in Auckland for a couple of weeks and was staying nearby - this place caught my eye so went in to try. Food was really great, very tasty and a great price. I enjoyed it so much i went back again a few nights later! Would recommend all to try it. Andrew This place has become my goto Turkish eatery. In my opinion the best lamb in Auckland and the rice is cooked so perfectly fluffy. The eatery is open late and I like to bring my friends here. The team is also very friendly. Dan Absolutely beautiful meals. We had the Lamb Shish Kebab and Mixed Platter . The lamb was perfect and so delicious. Both meals flavorsome and extremely enjoyable. We both so enjoyed our meals and our time at the little Turkish caf√©. We will be making this a regular place to eat. The service was friendly, welcoming, flawless.3 Lynette Stumbled across this awesome little cafe in Auckland during my weekend stay. We ordered the lamb on chips and a meatlovers pizza. The food was very good quality and tasted delicious. The pizza's are woodfired and it was perfectly done. The lamb on chips/lamb snack pack was also very tasty and filling. Thank you very much! Dario Good service, AMAZING food. great selection of vegetarian options. the atmosphere is great, from intimate indoor seating to the outdoor K-Road aesthetic. good for groups, get a shisha and a feed! delicious and pretty much a K-Road icon. Book a Berth Call Us A premier superyacht marina for refits and maintenance Port Nikau is a premier superyacht marina and a top destination for maintenance and refits in the South Pacific. Located in WhangƒÅrei's Port WhangƒÅrei, it offers world-class marine services and infrastructure, making it the only superyacht marina in New Zealand's northernmost city. Superyacht Marina Port Nikau is the perfect location to berth while completing refits, repairs or maintenance at our Superyacht Marina. FIND OUT MORE Cruising Yachts Port Nikau has dedicated piers for cruising yachts in Port Nikau Marina with berthage for up to 48 vessels, and additional berths for on-water maintenance at Eastpoint Marina. FIND OUT MORE Commercial Vessels Port Nikau is the ideal location for commercial vessels looking for close proximity to haul out services, and offers short and long-term berthage options. FIND OUT MORE Future of Port Nikau Port Nikau will offer a new way of urban waterfront living, with stunning harbour views, key amenities and a wide range of housing options available. Situated at the heart of WhangƒÅrei Harbour, it was once a bustling industrial and marine hub, servicing WhangƒÅrei township through significant periods of growth. homepage_content: Orbus Ferries Queenstown - Frankton to Queenstown Bay Take the lake Please check our facebook page for the latest schedule updates. Timetable Orbus Ferries Services Use your Bee Card on Orbus Ferries and save! Get your Bee Card here Please check our facebook page for the latest schedule updates, cancellation etc. Orbus Ferries Queenstown is a scheduled ferry service operating daily between Queenstown Bay and Frankton Marina. Stopping at the Hilton and Bayview. Early morning commuting trips Beat traffic and save on parking Timetable Route Click on any stop below to see in Google Maps. Queenstown Bay Bayview Marina Hilton Fares Hop on board, scan your Bee Card or bank card with the skipper, One-way fares only, no discount concessions for over 65 or children and cash not accepted. With Bee Card (one-way) $10 Without Bee Card (one-way) $14 Contact Email us info@queenstownferries.co.nz Find us 80 Beach Street, Steamer Wharf, Queenstown, New Zealand

name: rogerschicken.co.nz
homepage_content: Rogers Chicken Order Now Menu Signup Gallery Franchising Contact New Orleans style Cajun dusted Chicken Fingers! Order Now Huge selection & mouth watering flavours! Order Now Feed the family! Order Now Juicy Beef Burgers! Order Now Fries with Cheese & Gravy (Poutine)! Order Now Napier Store : 366 Gloucester Street, Taradale, Napier 4112 Hastings Store : 800 Karamu Road North, Hastings 4122 Our story New Orleans style Cajun dusted Chicken We just love Chicken! Ohh did I mention fried chicken. We wanted to create a recipe with a zing & punch, so we turned to New Orleans: The Mecca of Fried chicken! We put on our approns & worked on dozens of different recipes to come up with our house blend of Cajun dusting that had the perfect balance of flavours which would tickle your taste buds and keep you coming back for more. We hope you enjoy our tender and juicy chicken paired with smoky mayonnaise, seasoned fries and garlic bread with every combo bringing you an medley of flavours to satisfy your hunger cravings. name: taupoiz.com
homepage_content: Forget mediocre food WE ARE THE BEST When you are craving something that is rich in flavor and tastes like heaven, come see us at Taupo Indian Zaika! FULL MENU SPECIAL OFFERS JUST FOR YOU FROM OUR MASTER CHEF Combo Lunch Deal ($16) 1 Curry + Rice + 1 Baby Naan (vegetarian or non-vegetarian) Combo Dinner Deal ($26) 1 Curry + Rice + 1 Baby Naan + 1 Drink (vegetarian or non-vegetarian) Kids Deal See kids menu Our Awesome Restaurant Located in the heart of the beautiful city of Taupo, Taupo Indian Zaika is a takeout restaurant, serving authentic cuisine from the Northern India. Be sure to check out our collection of Indian sweets with very rich flavors that make a perfect dessert for you and your family. If you are you not ready for a full meal but want to have something small yet delicious, look no further. We offer a variety of delicious Indian snacks that you can choose from. homepage_content: The Rope and Twine: Delightful Dining in South Dunedin Savory Delights Await Unforgettable Flavor Journey Get A Reservation Now Warm Welcomes Always Service with a Smile View Menu Cozy Atmosphere Your Local Dining Escape Enjoy a relaxing meal in our inviting space, perfect for any occasion or celebration. Get A Reservation Now View Menu Hello dear Welcome to The Rope and Twine At The Rope and Twine, nestled in the heart of South Dunedin, we embrace a passion for great food and warm hospitality. Our menu features delightful dishes, from creamy garlic aioli to succulent braised pork belly, crafted with care to ensure every bite is memorable. Patrons rave about our generous portions and friendly service, creating a cozy atmosphere that welcomes everyone. Weekly specials invite you to explore new flavors while enjoying the charm of our bar and restaurant. Join us for a meal that not only satisfies but also connects you with the local community through shared dining experiences. see more Today's Suggestions Explore the featured selections! $33.49 Roast Of The Day $30.00 Chicken Bacon Or Beef Bacon Burger $3.00 Aioli $5.00 Extra Sour Cream Discover Full Menu About The Rope and Twine Welcome to The Rope and Twine , a cozy bar and restaurant nestled at 67 Macandrew Road in South Dunedin, New Zealand. This charming eatery has quickly become a beloved spot for locals and visitors alike, known for its delightful menu and warm atmosphere. The Rope and Twine stands out with its focus on quality ingredients and generous portion sizes. Here, you can indulge in a variety of mouthwatering dishes designed to satisfy any craving. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty Chicken, Bacon, or Beef Bacon Burger for $30.00‚Äîcomplete with gherkin, lettuce, tomato, grilled cheese, and sriracha aioli‚Äîor the delectable Blue Cod , served beer-battered or pan-fried with salad and fries for $75.40, every bite promises a burst of flavor. One of the highlights of dining at The Rope and Twine is the attention given to details. Customers rave about the excellent service and the friendly staff , who make everyone feel like a welcome guest. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a casual lunch or a special occasion. Regular customer Erika Astried shared her appreciation for the cozy dining room and the enticing specials that keep her coming back for more. It‚Äôs moments like these that turn a simple meal into a memorable experience. Bucket List Dishes: Chicken Schnitzel: Tender chicken with fresh greens and rich mushroom gravy. Roast Beef with Yorkshire Pudding: A classic that simply cannot be beaten. Eggs Benedict: A brunch favorite that impresses every time. Additional Treats: Mushroom Sauce: A rich, satisfying addition. Bowl of Wedges: Perfectly crispy potato wedges to complement any meal. As you explore the menu, you'll find options that cater to all tastes, whether you're a meat lover or seeking lighter fare. And don‚Äôt forget to try the Tuatara tap beer , highly recommended by regulars for its refreshing quality. The Rope and Twine isn‚Äôt just about great food; it‚Äôs about the community it fosters. Customers like Sinclair McLaren praise not only the food and drinks but the spirited atmosphere created by the cheerful staff. Whether celebrating a birthday lunch, enjoying a casual meal with friends, or simply kicking back after a long day, The Rope and Twine provides an experience that feels like home. If you‚Äôre seeking a place where good food meets excellent service in a cozy setting, look no further than The Rope and Twine. You‚Äôll leave with a full belly and a happy heart. People talk Our Guestbook ‚Äú Had a delicious birthday lunch there today and the food was delicious and with good portion sizes. Will definitely go there again ‚Äù - Tikva NZ (TikvaNZ) ‚Äú The food & drinks are good and a reasonable price but the big difference at this restaurant/bar are the girls, waitresses and behind the bar. They are always bright, happy & friendly and make all the customers welcome. They make the place special. ‚Äù - Sinclair McLaren ‚Äú This is a cozy bar and restaurant in South Dunedin. One thing that makes me interested is they have specials deals and promotions during the week. So you can choose which suit you. The staffs are friendly and provides excellent services. Price is good, taste yum, cozy dining room, clean and they play the music fairly. Will back next time to experiencing other dish. ‚Äù - Erika Astried ‚Äú Such a great restaurant and food is delicious. Staff are friendly and cheerful. 10/10 would recommend. ‚Äù - Alan Larson ‚Äú Had delicious lunch today. Chicken schnitzel was yummy and comparatively bigger size.fresh greens, tender chicken and tasty mushroom gravy. Chicken burger was also tasty. Quite good filling and chips are crispy.Service and atmosphere was good. one of the best bar food in dunedin. ‚Äù - Saravan Kumar

homepage_content: #The Wayfarer - Dunedin‚Äôs Under the Radar Cocktail Sanctuary The Wayfarer Speakeasy & Cocktail Lounge ‚ú® Speakeasy & Cocktail Lounge ‚ú® Discover the vibrant flavours and warm vibes of our cocktails and desserts. Available for Private Hire Planning a special celebration or work event? üéâ‚ú® Our space is the perfect spot for an unforgettable experience. Let us take care of everything with delicious food, handcrafted cocktails ü•Çüåé Get in touch to chat about your event and lock in your exclusive booking! üì© Opening Hours 7 BATH STREET DUNEDIN 9016, NEW ZEALAND Serving Wednesday to Saturday 5PM ‚Äì Late Gift Card The Wayfarer Buying gifts can be tricky, but with The Wayfarer Gift Card you‚Äôre giving your friends and family an experience they‚Äôll truly enjoy. The Wayfarer Gift Cards are perfect for serving one‚Äôs convenience. Purchased online, they are emailed directly ‚Äì simply print it out or use it straight from a mobile device. You can also purchase a physical gift card from our friendly staff at the venue. Purchase Gift Card Here Discover The Pursuit of the Perfect Night Step across the threshold and leave the mundane world behind. Our aim is to send you on a sensory journey into a concealed world, where the evening is curated and inhibitions are gently shed. Here, we are devoted to atmosphere and service ‚Äîa sophisticated haven for the discerning and the curious. This is more than a bar; it is a private sanctuary where one can feast on fine libations and the sweet thrill of a moment suspended in time. The romance of low light and hidden corners invites chance encounters and brings a delicious tranquillity from the first moment you enter. You never know who you might meet when the right music plays and the conversation flows so easily. Our commitment is to your sublime enjoyment . Our extensive cocktail list is a testament to the distiller‚Äôs art, an adventure through classics and bespoke creations, each a liquid masterpiece. For those with a refined palate , we offer a carefully curated selection of premium wines alongside a concise range of local and international beers . Every drink is a pursuit of flavour, setting our lounge apart from anything else you can experience. Vodka, lychee liquor, cranberry juice. Mandarin infused dry gin, campari, rouge vermouth. Cocktail Masterclasses The Wayfarer Elevate your appreciation for fine spirits. Our Cocktail Masterclasses are a unique opportunity to step behind the curtain and learn the precise techniques, intricate flavours, and true art of the world‚Äôs best cocktails. Our highly trained service team takes pride and pleasure in guiding guests through the history and execution of the classics, teaching you to create your own liquid masterpieces. This experience is perfect for group bookings, celebrations, or simply refining your own private repertoire . Ask us about scheduling your class and commanding the shaker! name: boatcafe.co.nz
homepage_content: Boat Cafe 0 A dining experience like no other welcome aboard We've switched to using beef tallow for deep frying, and are working towards a seed oil-free kitchen. However, we understand that dietary preferences and requirements vary, so we still offer a non-animal fat fryer option for vegetarians and those with dietary needs, or simply for those who prefer a different taste! FOOD Drinks welcome to a special piece of New Zealand history... This classic steam tug was one of the last of her kind. Originally named the Aucklander , she was delivered from Scotland all the way to Auckland in 1958. She spent years towing and ship handling around the Auckland port until she was replaced by the technology of new engines. In 1986, a Wellington businessman by the name of Clem Griffiths purchased her to establish Wellington‚Äôs first and only floating restaurant. After renaming the vessel Tapuhi II , the ‚ÄúTugboat on the Bay‚Äù restaurant opened to the public at Oriental Bay in 1992. She‚Äôs undergone quite a few changes over the years, but to this day she continues to float proudly. Now under new management, we hope to provide you with friendly service, delicious food and the best views of the harbour! Come eat, drink and relax ‚Äì you‚Äôre always welcome on our boat. Looking for a venue? We have the perfect spot to host your next party or event. Email us theboatnz@gmail.com today to discuss your options! homepage_content: Huka Lodge New Zealand | Luxury Taupo Accommodation NZ | 5-Star Resorts By the river at Huka Lodge Long regarded as one of the world‚Äôs most revered and inspirational luxury accommodations, Huka Lodge is set among 17-acres of established, parklike gardens along the banks of the emerald-blue Waikato River near Lake Taup≈ç on New Zealand‚Äôs North Island. With humble beginnings more than a century ago as a fisher‚Äôs camp with white canvas tents pegged along the trout-rich river, Huka Lodge has today secured its place as one of the country‚Äôs oldest and most celebrated luxury lodges. In 2024 Huka Lodge closed for a carefully considered ‚Äòcentenary redesign‚Äô, and reopened its doors in March 2025, ready to welcome a next generation of global luxury traveller. Step inside to experience our luxury Regal luxury Fit for a King: twenty guest suites along with two exclusive owners' residences, the Alan Pye Cottage and Alex van Heeren Cottage, are dotted along the banks of the Waikato River and among verdant gardens, each opening onto rolling green lawns and with the sounds of birdsong and the burbling river as nature's orchestral score. Find your suite Exclusive packages & offers Exclusive packages The century-young Huka Lodge welcomes guests to Taup≈ç in the heart of New Zealand‚Äôs North Island. Specially tailored packages are generously inclusive and allow for extended stays with extra benefits. Explore Taup≈ç Elegant dining The fine dining and exceptional cuisine on offer at Huka Lodge continues to define the world-class hospitality experience. A vast wine cellar of premium vintages complements a daily-changing menu, showcasing New Zealand‚Äôs finest produce. The restaurant, bar, lounges and terrace offer a traditional lodging ambiance, while signature dining venues are dotted around the estate. Whet your appetite Grand heritage Founded as a fisherman‚Äôs camp in 1924 with white canvas tents pegged by the Waikato River, Huka Lodge was recognised first as a best-kept secret among anglers and grew in popularity with guests from around the world drawn to the property‚Äôs signature checked lawns leading to the river‚Äôs swirling eddies and rushing rapids. A century on, Huka Lodge has a grand heritage, rich in stories and history to be discovered. At Baillie Lodges we have honoured his legacy by renaming the Owner‚Äôs Cottage as the Alex van Heeren Cottage. VIEW COTTAGE With a reputation for peerless fly fishing and generous hospitality, Huka Lodge combines class, discretion and impeccable service in one of the most serene locations on the planet. John Barker Escape Huka Lodge has legendary status in New Zealand, it is spoken about in revered tones. On arrival, I realised there may be more to this place than a fancy room and breath-taking views. Kelli Brett Cuisine I cannot readily articulate just how the property held me in its grasp at first sight. However, it did, and still does to this day. Was it the sheer force and power of the turquoise green waters of the Waikato River on the one hand and all that tranquility and softness on the other? Perhaps it was simply the contradiction of the two. Alex van Heeren Founder, Huka Lodge There are so many things to like: the riverfront setting; the lavish duplex accommodations; and the superb cuisine. It is one of the finest hideaways of its type in the world. homepage_content: Greater Wellington ‚Äî Queen Elizabeth Park Queen Elizabeth Park | Greater Wellington Queen Elizabeth Park Haere mai, welcome to Queen Elizabeth Park location_on Location Located between PaekƒÅkƒÅriki and Raumati South, KƒÅpiti Coast This is one of our most popular parks - a great place for a day out with family and friends on the KƒÅpiti Coast. Opening hours Parks are always open to foot traffic. Vehicle gates are open 6am-6pm 1 April ‚Äì 30 Sept, and 6am-9pm 1 Oct ‚Äì 31 Mar. info_outline Notices Activities Walking and hiking Mountain biking and cycling Dog walking Horse riding Model aeroplane flying Volunteering History US Marines history Learn more > open_in_new See more Activities add Walking and hiking Queen Elizabeth Park has a variety of different trails and most are suitable for pushchairs and wheelchairs. Each track offers a different experience - around wetlands, through dunes, amongst kahikatea forest remnants, across paddocks, or beside the coast and passing historical landmarks. Most tracks are shared with either cyclists, horses, or both, so be aware and take care. Queen Elizabeth Park trail map Read more here date_range Published 15 Jul 2022 Download now (PDF 753 KB) get_app Track Time / grade Details Whareroa stream loop 1 hour return / easy The track follows Whareroa Stream through farmland to the rolling sandhills of the northern Inland Track. Along the track you will see a number of native re-vegetation plantings. Turn left onto the northern Inland Track and do the loop walk back to Mackays Crossing via Whareroa Road. Te Ara o Tipapa (wetland walk) 45 minutes return / easy This track runs through the Mackays Crossing wetlands, then crosses low dunes to wetlands that alternate seasonally from dry to wet. Continue to the bush remnant, the only piece of original kahikatea forest remaining on the KƒÅpiti Coast. You can follow a shady track through the remnant or walk on by for good views over the equestrian paddock and the park entrance. Further on you walk through the ‚ÄúMarines‚Äù wetland, first planted in 2003, then past the memorial commemorating the camps that were here during World War II. Coastal Track 1 hour 20 minutes / moderate This walk follows the seaward dunes along the coast between PaekƒÅkƒÅriki and Whareroa Beach, with an entry point at either end. See pingao and spinifex catching and holding the sand on the foreshore while further back muehlenbeckia, shore bindweed and flax protect and strengthen the dune system. A variety of short tracks along the way link with the beach. This is an intermediate mountain bike track with some short, steep sections. If you wish to continue north to Raumati South, you can either use the beach or the Te Ara o Whareroa trail. Find out more at Find Your Wild Inland Track 40 minutes / moderate Th e main section of the Inland Track winds through rolling sand dune ridges between the Memorial lookout in PaekƒÅkƒÅriki and heads north providing stunning views of both Mana and KƒÅpiti Island. It ends at The Coastal Track just before Whareroa Road. Find out more at Find Your Wild Yankee Trail 90 minutes return / easy to moderate Yankee Trail ‚Äì This trail takes you between the two US Marines memorials in Queen Elizabeth Park. Retrace the steps of the US Marines who used this track to walk between Camp Mackay and PaekƒÅkƒÅriki in 1942 and 1943. A sheltered, undulating track that is an easy to intermediate mountain bike ride. Te Ara o Whareroa 2 hours / easy to moderate This is an easy 6km sealed trail that traverses the dune lands of KƒÅpiti Coast, just one hour‚Äôs drive from Wellington. The trail extends from Poplar Avenue in Raumati South all the way through Queen Elizabeth Park to Tilley Road in PaekƒÅkƒÅriki. This popular shared route is used by locals for recreational walking and biking. Find out more at Find Your Wild Dune Swamp Loop 30 minutes/easy to moderate This area has been a long term restoration project by The Friends of QEP and Greater Wellington. Initially the area was planted with pioneer species and now trees such as kahikatea are starting to emerge. The planting has gradually crept year-by[1]year towards the railway line and is slowly helping to form a bush corridor from the coast to Whareroa Farm, and eventually Akatarawa Forest. The walk is a reasonably flat grass track that can be a little bit muddy in the winter. It‚Äôs suitable for most fitness levels, walking and horse riding, but not ideal for buggies. Peatland Ridge Track 30 minutes/easy to moderate The 1.4km walk from Rainbow Court to the Pony Club gate follows gentle undulating terrain that allows you to see the transition from farming to a newly formed native forest. You will walk past regenerating native bush and newly formed natural wetlands as you get near the Old Farm Track. Continue onto the ridge where you will have views over the northern corner of the park where much of the area has being replanted. This replanting was an initiative funded by The Maclean Trust. A peat restoration project is also in the pipeline. Old Farm Track 60 minutes/easy This 3.5km flat, easy walk will take you through previously farmed areas of the park. You will see native regeneration take place over the coming years which is the result of the Recloaking Papat≈´ƒÅnuku project started in 2022. Walk from Poplar Avenue in Raumati South (this entrance is not suitable for parking) all the way to the Mackays Crossing entrance. Peatland Loop 40 minutes/moderate This 2.2km loop is a great place to bring your horse as it's a more remote grass track and not as suitable for cycling. You may see a number of changes in this area over the coming years due to peat restoration projects. KƒÅnuka Track 7 mins/easy This 500m track links from Te Ara o Whareroa Trail into the parts of the park opened in 2022 and conveniently connects with The Old Farm Track and The Peatland Loop. See more Walking and tramping add Mountain biking and cycling The Te Ara o Whareroa trail runs from one end of the park to the other, connecting PaekƒÅkƒÅriki with Raumati South. It's the perfect place for a family bike ride as the track is sealed, making it accessible for all kinds of wheels, and easier for little legs. There are a number of other tracks available to cyclists. While these are not sealed, they aren't necessarily designed for die-hard mountain bikers, and instead would be suited to recreational riders, families and those wanting to take it easy and admire the view. Before you go All tracks are shared with pedestrians and some tracks are also shared with horses, so take care and give way to other users. If you're interested in more challenging routes, across the motorway at Whareroa Farm , you can find a number of tracks that will provide more interesting terrain. Tracks Track Difficulty Whareroa stream loop Easy Coastal Track Intermediate (some short steep sections) Inland Track Intermediate (some short steep sections) Yankee Trail Easy to intermediate Te Ara o Whareroa Easy Peatland Ridge Track Easy to intermediate Old Farm Track Easy KƒÅnuka Track Easy Queen Elizabeth Park trail map Read more here date_range Published 15 Jul 2022 Download now (PDF 753 KB) get_app See more Mountain biking/cycling add Dog walking Dogs are welcome in all parts of the park, except for the Te Ara o Tipapa Loop and Dune Swamp Loop. While dogs are not required to be on a lead, please keep them under control and pick up after them at all times. Queen Elizabeth Park trail map Read more here date_range Published 15 Jul 2022 Download now (PDF 753 KB) get_app See more Dog walking add Horse riding Queen Elizabeth Park is a lovely spot for horse riding, with easy trails over farmland and good access to the beach. There is also plenty of space to park horse floats. Things to think about Follow the parks care code Model aircraft and trams in the park - both can be scary for horses. The jumps at the front of the park are for organised activities only. See the Eventing Wellington website for details. Beach and tracks Horse riding is allowed on multiple tracks in the park. You can also ride in the neighbouring Whareroa Farm where there is a good range of riding tracks. Horses are permitted on all KƒÅpiti beaches with restrictions on beach urban areas during summer . You must ride your horse in a safe and careful manner when on the beach. Keep your horse out of the dunes, as these areas are fragile and contain breeding birds and erosion-control plants. Tracks Details Whareroa Stream Loop 1 hour/4km return. Easy riding. Be aware that this track goes past the model aircraft club area. Inland Track Takes you to PaekƒÅkƒÅriki. Ride the track one way and along the beach on your return. Yankee Trail Loops around the Eventing Wellington area. Dune Swamp loop This is a reasonably flat grass track, taking through restoration areas. Peatland Ridge Track This area provides some great views over the park. Old Farm Track Takes you from Poplar Avenue in Raumati South to the Mackays Crossing entrance. Peatland Loop Flat grass loop in the previously farmed area of the park. KƒÅnuka Track A link track between Te Ara o Whareroa Trail and The Old Farm Track. Queen Elizabeth Park trail map Read more here date_range Published 15 Jul 2022 Download now (PDF 753 KB) get_app Eventing Queen Elizabeth Park is the home to Wellington Eventing - a discipline in horse riding where riders compete across three events (dressage, show jumping and cross country) over a day or more. In each event a rider can earn penalties, and at the end of the three events, the rider with the least penalties wins. Eventing is an area of horse riding that New Zealand has excelled in with numerous Olympic and world championship successes. For more information on Wellington Eventing competitions held at Queen Elizabeth Park see NZ Equestrian . See more Horse riding add Model aeroplane flying Queen Elizabeth Park is home to KƒÅpiti Aeromodellers Club. The club has an airfield accessible from the Mackays Crossing entrance. Spectators are welcome at any time at the club when members are flying. Visitors are asked to park outside the pits area. A suitable spot is signposted to the right of the pits entrance. Find out more and join the club See more Flying model aeroplanes add Volunteering So much of the work done in the regional parks wouldn't be possible without the help of people in our communities. If you want to contribute to the care of Queen Elizabeth Park, you can join one of our community groups. Volunteering in our parks See more Volunteering add History Queen Elizabeth Park and the land it sits on has long attracted people to the area. MƒÅori and European settlement history MƒÅori have been living here for hundreds of years and there were major settlements at Wainui and Whareroa up until the mid-1800s. At the beginning of the 19th century, the KƒÅpiti Coast was occupied by the Muaupoko and Ngati Apa peoples. Over the 19th century there were a number of raids and resulting battles that brought other tribes to the area, including Ngapuhi, Ngati Toa, Ngati Whatua, Waikato and Maniopoto. The land where Queen Elizabeth Park now sits was an important area. The waterways between the sand hills were deep and plentiful, and it was said that canoes could be paddled from PaekƒÅkƒÅriki to Waikanae. From the 1830s onwards, European ships, including whaling boats regularly moored in between KƒÅpiti Island and the coast, as it was a sheltered place to settle. Local MƒÅori gradually left the area and European settlers farmed there. Land was cleared, the wetlands between the sand hills drained and pasture sown. From the 1840s the beach formed part of the main road north, with many travellers stopping overnight at Whareroa. Communication routes improved further and the railway line between Wellington and Foxton was completed in 1886. By the turn of the 20th century, the beach highway was still providing access for the beachfront sections being developed in Raumati and Paraparaumu. The history of this area is rich and complex. For more detailed information, see the QEP Resource Statement (PDF 2.8 MB) . See more Historic add US Marines history Between 1942 and 1944 you would have been forgiven for thinking Queen Elizabeth Park had been taken over by Americans, because we had! During those years over 15,000 American troops were stationed at Queen Elizabeth Park (then Camp Russell), Whareroa Farm (then Camp Mackay) and PaekƒÅkƒÅriki Village (then Camp PaekƒÅkƒÅriki). When World War II broke out in 1939, New Zealand gave total support to Britain and sent our army to the Mediterranean. By 1942, Singapore had fallen and the South Pacific was under threat by Japan. New Zealand agreed to leave its army in North Africa, and so the United States Marines were sent to New Zealand to prepare for the possibility of a Pacific War and protect the country from an invasion. Training tragedy Training took up a lot of the troops' time. The land around the camps was used for live firing exercises, and there were 24km route marches up PaekƒÅkƒÅriki Hill Road (known as "Little Burma Road" to the marines), as well as exercises on the Tararua Ranges. One training activity ended in the deaths of 10 sailors. On June 20, 1943 there was a beach landing training. They were practising for assaults on the Japanese occupied Pacific Islands. Everything seemed to go wrong during this exercise. One boat, named the "beach party" was supposed to be the first onshore and the last to leave the shore during the exercise. Their job was to prepare the beach for the 1,600 marines to follow them. This boat had 25 men on board. During the exercise the tide stranded the boats on the beach, while the weather hit them with freezing cold rain and strong winds and a rising surf. As the last boat off the beach, the beach party didn't leave the shores until after nightfall. When they finally did get to the water their engine woudn't start so a larger boat towed them out stern first (backwards). The waves crashed onto the boat and because the boat was backwards it couldn't ride the waves, instead they hit it and went over it with force. When they were still a good distance from the ship, the boat capsized, throwing the 25 men into the freezing sea. Ten men drowned that night, nine swam ashore and six more were picked up by rescue boats. The WWII U.S. Marines Camp interpretation tells the story of the Marines based at the camp and local residents. We would like to acknowledge The Kapiti US Marines Trust for the work they have done bringing this project to life. You can find this sign via the Wellington Road, PaekƒÅkƒÅriki Entrance to Queen Elizabeth Park, near where Wainui Stream crosses Queen Elizabeth Road. Find the location on Google Maps. To learn more about the history of the Marines stationed in Queen Elizabeth Park, visit Marinesnz.com . See more Historic Description Grab your sneakers, bike or horse - there are tracks here for everyone! Jump on the tram for a ride to the beach or go bird spotting in the wetlands. Find out about the US Marines who trained here in WWII. Learn more about the Trams and Tramway Museum Ramaroa Centre Maclean Trust Project Know before you go Dogs are welcome in all parts of the park, except for the Te Ara o Tipapa Loop. Whilst dogs are not required to be on a lead, please keep them under control and pick up after them at all times. Camp at the PaekƒÅkƒÅriki Holiday Park near the south entrance. Fireworks are banned in all Regional Parks and Forests. Download the park brochure Queen Elizabeth Park brochure Queen Elizabeth Park is the last area of natural dunes on KƒÅpiti‚Äôs coastline. MƒÅori have been living here for hundreds of years and there were major settlements at Wainui and Whareroa‚Ä¶ Read more here date_range Published 15 Jul 2022 Download now (PDF 1.1 MB) get_app Getting there There are three main entrances and each offers a slightly different experience of the park: Mackays Crossing entrance off SH1 PaekƒÅkƒÅriki entrances Raumati South entrances By public transport Train: Catch the Metlink KƒÅpiti Line to the PaekƒÅkƒÅriki railway station, visit the museum in the station and then walk or bike 1.5km to the southern park entrance at the end of Wellington Road. Bus: Take the route 250 bus from Paraparaumu railway station to Jeep Rd (Stop 1470: Jeep Road at the Esplanade or, Stop: 1472 Jeep Road at Forrest Road), Raumati South. Head to Metlink to plan your journey: By bike Plan your route with the KƒÅpiti, Porirua, Tawa cycle map. KƒÅpiti, Porirua and Tawa Cycle Map 2023 | Ko te Mahere Pahikara o KƒÅpiti, o Porirua, o Tawa 2025 Bike network of the Greater Wellington region - Ko ngƒÅ ara Pahikara o P≈çneke Nui Tonu Please Note: Updated Key. The Key now advises users of paths marked as ‚ÄúOff road‚Ä¶ Read more here date_range Published 30 Jan 2023 Download now (PDF 17 MB) get_app By car Mackays Crossing entrance off SH1 The main entrance is near the Ramaroa Centre and the Tramway Museum. Along the road are walking, cycling and horse riding tracks, the WWII US Marines display, restored wetlands and the kahikatea forest remnant. The road continues to Whareroa Beach, surrounding dunes and picnic areas. PaekƒÅkƒÅriki entrances This entrance near the PaekƒÅkƒÅriki Holiday Park gives access to picnic areas, the surf lifesaving club and safe swimming. Turn off SH1 into the PaekƒÅkƒÅriki township and turn right into Wellington Road. The park entrance is at the end of Wellington Road. Access the southern end of the Te Ara o Whareroa trail through the Tilley Road Reserve on Tilley Road. Raumati South entrances Access to walking and cycling tracks including the Te Ara o Whareroa trail, dune systems, and the KƒÅpiti Pony Club. Turn off SH1 at Poplar Ave and follow the road to its end at the Esplanade. Turn left and drive for about 1km to reach the park entrance. Access to the northern end of the Te Ara o Whareroa trail from Matai Road. alarm Updated November 14, 2025 at 10:01 AM Get in touch Phone: 0800496734 Email: info@gw.govt.nz

Join us for lunch and dinner 7 days a week - we also cater for breakfasts on request. Check out our vibrant menu to see what takes your fancy! Book out our Oamaru Restaurant and Bar and enjoy a fully catered meal, complimented by a great range of New Zealand and Australian wines. For large groups, book out our Northstar Restaurant and enjoy the convenience of a short walk home to your motel accommodation, at the end of your evening. name: weareiti.co.nz
homepage_content: Iti - a drinks & bites garden | Titirangi food and drink | 421 Titirangi Road, Titirangi, Auckland, New Zealand top of page We are iTi. A drinks & bites garden in the soul of Titirangi. If you‚Äôre into native bush, craft beer on tap, the best cocktails & wine, you‚Äôll find yourself at home around here. Saturday & Sunday music every week to feed your soul! Cheers to that! See Menu Book Now The Lewisham Awards 2024 Outstanding Local Establishment - West iTi has won the Lewisham Award for Outstanding Local Establishment‚ÄîWest. A big thank you to everyone who voted for us and to our amazing team, who work hard every day to make your visit with us so enjoyable. Named after Richard Lewisham, a pioneer of the Auckland Hospitality Scene, The Lewisham Awards were established in 2002 with the main objective of encouraging excellence in the city's hospitality community. With this in mind, the best in the business are nominated and honoured by their peers once a year, followed by an after-party to celebrate their success. Find out more Estrella Damm Top 50 New Zealand Gastropubs We were thrilled that ITI Drinks & Bites Garden, was named a finalist for these prestigious New Zealand Awards. At ITI, we strive to create a welcoming atmosphere where people can indulge in innovative dishes made from locally sourced ingredients, paired with a curated selection of beverages showcasing the best Kiwi hospitality. We were thrilled to be included on this list alongside such a fantastic group of gastropubs. Thanks also to our loyal customers and community for their ongoing support and for voting us into the finalist category. Find out more bottom of page

We‚Äôre within walking distance of the Vodafone Events Centre and Vector Wero Whitewater Park, as well as minutes from Rainbow‚Äôs End theme park and Auckland Botanic Gardens. Go shopping at Westfield Manukau City, hit the greens of Wattle Downs Golf Course, or head into the heart of Auckland, 23 kilometers away. Back at our non-smoking hotel, make the most of a gym, caf√©, and free WiFi. All the Right Amenities You'll love our fitness center Our contemporary hotel has everything you need for a relaxing stay. Grab breakfast, lunch, or a tasty snack at our on-site caf√©, or kick back and order room service. Stay active in our well-equipped fitness center, use free high-speed WiFi to plan the day, and host your next event in our meeting space. You can also take advantage of paid parking. Each comfortable, non-smoking guest room is thoughtfully appointed with a flat-screen HDTV with cable, a kitchenette with mini-refrigerator and coffee maker, ironing amenities, and hair dryer. Explore the Auckland Area Ride a coaster, discover outdoor beauty, or visit museums Tackle two rafting courses at the Vector Wero Whitewater Park or ride the epic Corkscrew Coaster at Rainbow‚Äôs End. Check out the collection of exotic palms at the Auckland Botanic Gardens, see salt water crocodiles at Butterfly Creek Zoo, or enjoy a hike and picnic at Totara Park.
